commit_message:
Update Ansible version to stable-2.1

Updated the version to be installed to stable-2.1 as well
as updated some of the playbooks that were incorrectly
passing string arguments instead of dictionary arguments
for authentication since Ansible 2.1 has checks that
detect this.

Additionally, updated the task labels used for unsetting
authentiction parameters to be more consistent with the
state of the code.

Change-Id: I8c50cd2a722f2c8fee91fb6ef0761969dd3da138

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-20 12:55:23.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/test_os_vif_util.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/kuryr_fixtures.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/controller/service.py', 'requirements.txt', 'kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/default_subnet.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/os_vif_util.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/base.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/config.py', 'setup.cfg', 'kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/controller/drivers/test_default_subnet.py'], 'message': "Default pod subnet driver and os-vif utils

This patch adds a new driver type used to determine Neutron subnet
that should be used for Kubernetes pods' ports. This patch also
provides a default subnet driver implementation that uses a
subnet set in configuration file.

This patch also introduces the 'os_vif_util' module that contains
functions to translate data structures returned by Neutron client to
os-vif objects. Only the subnet-related functions are added in this
patch.

Change-Id: I643b22858239ce7f64e6ba81822b31e788fc9990
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration
"}]
commit_message:
Default pod subnet driver and os-vif utils

This patch adds a new driver type used to determine Neutron subnet
that should be used for Kubernetes pods' ports. This patch also
provides a default subnet driver implementation that uses a
subnet set in configuration file.

This patch also introduces the 'os_vif_util' module that contains
functions to translate data structures returned by Neutron client to
os-vif objects. Only the subnet-related functions are added in this
patch.

Change-Id: I643b22858239ce7f64e6ba81822b31e788fc9990
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-16 17:56:22.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/glance/lite-specs.rst'], 'message': 'Return 409 if removing/replacing image locations.

Currently image location updates (removing, replacing) are permitted for
images even if their state is not ``active``.
This lite-spec describes the need to prevent removal of image
locations of images that are not in ``active`` state and the replacement of
image locations of images that are not in ``active`` or ``queued`` state by
returning a Conflict Error (409 response code).

Change-Id: I6d984fcafa49ad806dce2bd56abcee66fdc77525
'}]
commit_message:
Return 409 if removing/replacing image locations.

Currently image location updates (removing, replacing) are permitted for
images even if their state is not ``active``.
This lite-spec describes the need to prevent removal of image
locations of images that are not in ``active`` state and the replacement of
image locations of images that are not in ``active`` or ``queued`` state by
returning a Conflict Error (409 response code).

Change-Id: I6d984fcafa49ad806dce2bd56abcee66fdc77525

'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/openstack-network/agents/l3.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/heat/heat.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/spec/unit/type/override_resources_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/cluster-haproxy/cluster-haproxy.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/openstack-network/agents/metadata.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/heat/heat.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_controller/openstack_controller.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/openstack-network/server-config.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/roles/compute.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_cinder/openstack_cinder.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/server_config.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/openstack-network/plugins/ml2.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/ceilometer/compute.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/agents/sriov.pp'], 'message': "Refactoring of the override_resources type for the IaC feature

This commit changes override_resources type allowing to
- specify any puppet resource
- pass any number of resources

It also introduces the logic to decide whether override_resources
should create a new resource, if it hasn't been found in the catalog.

The resource overrides as well as additional settings are taken from
Hiera.

This logic essentially allows to create any Puppet resource via
passing the right hash to the Hiera. It replaces/extends the old
'Advanced configuration' feature.

Change-Id: I81099ac41c3e2abdaf6fde3a19161709b7ba4b8c
Blueprint: puppet-resource-override
"}]
commit_message:
Refactoring of the override_resources type for the IaC feature

This commit changes override_resources type allowing to
- specify any puppet resource
- pass any number of resources

It also introduces the logic to decide whether override_resources
should create a new resource, if it hasn't been found in the catalog.

The resource overrides as well as additional settings are taken from
Hiera.

This logic essentially allows to create any Puppet resource via
passing the right hash to the Hiera. It replaces/extends the old
'Advanced configuration' feature.

Change-Id: I81099ac41c3e2abdaf6fde3a19161709b7ba4b8c
Blueprint: puppet-resource-override

A recent change to the wsgi code broke deployments running over
httpd/mod_wsgi. This is because for py2.X mod_wsgi accepts byte
strings and breaks with utf8. However, for py3.X, utf8 is

Change-Id: I81739bc3de9d623b718987b5fc18eaf851533902

commit_message:
Use byte string or utf8 depending on python version for wsgi

A recent change to the wsgi code broke deployments running over
httpd/mod_wsgi. This is because for py2.X mod_wsgi accepts byte
strings and breaks with utf8. However, for py3.X, utf8 is
accepted. So this acts accordingly.

Change-Id: I81739bc3de9d623b718987b5fc18eaf851533902
Closes-Bug: #1643511
(cherry picked from commit 11d8dde452b3ce52f77a637e1d6c98080bbd7fa2)

commit_message:
[PY3] byte/string conversions and enable PY3 test

* The dict.items()[0] will raise a TypeError in PY3,
  as dict.items() doesn't return a list any more in PY3
  but a view of list.
* Webob response body should be bytes not strings so used
  oslo_utils.encodeutils.safe_decode to decode it.

Partially implements blueprint: goal-python35
Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>

Change-Id: I38d416923bc0cec0ca98c4494dd1e06cd49671cf
(cherry picked from commit 0f152eb66153e16d4d8aba0f8afebaab046aea35)

commit_message:
DB API changes, Quota changes for the nova-manage quota_usage_refresh
command.

The patch implements the database API changes that will be
needed by the new nova-manage quota_usage_refresh command.

A new API is added to refresh the quota usages of the
selected resources.

Another API is added to get the PER_PROJECT_QUOTAS, which
will be needed later in the patch sequence.

Implements blueprint: refresh-quotas-usage

Change-Id: Id36328b2f2016eab2d7194b88d3eee8d016786d1
(cherry picked from commits 4a95c1c5ea4600f3068b021329101e891eb79158,
 c2dd3cd1adde130799339abd47d6fa380276d895,
 8d25383ad2a1bdde22e306bf9daa52508c90dd3d)

subject: Make direct_client not override User-Agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 15:11:28.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_direct_client.py', 'swift/common/direct_client.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py'], 'message': "Make direct_client not override User-Agent

Currently direct_client will always set the user agent in it's
request headers to be 'direct_client <PID>'.

This patch changes the behaviour so that if a User-Agent header is
included with the headers given to direct_client functions then
that User-Agent value will be preserved.

This is motivated by changing the replicator and reconstructor to use
direct_client, allowing them to pass in their own User-Agent values.

Change-Id: I157df1397ff35a3e05e05a353b2f11df698e4acd
"}]
commit_message:
Make direct_client not override User-Agent

Currently direct_client will always set the user agent in it's
request headers to be 'direct_client <PID>'.

This patch changes the behaviour so that if a User-Agent header is
included with the headers given to direct_client functions then
that User-Agent value will be preserved.

This is motivated by changing the replicator and reconstructor to use
direct_client, allowing them to pass in their own User-Agent values.

Change-Id: I157df1397ff35a3e05e05a353b2f11df698e4acd

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I30a0a1dbee467e6ae1efd7bea5d0e3c745c59bbb
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I30a0a1dbee467e6ae1efd7bea5d0e3c745c59bbb

subject: Revert "Set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS in fwaas devstack plugin"
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-22 12:32:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_fwaasv2_extensions.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Revert "Set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS in fwaas devstack plugin"

This reverts commit 8bf87a0b0593d0a26604678c5c3ee170f251aa83.

Becauase setting NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS unconditionally
interferes other subprojects.  (networking-midonet gate is
broken due to this.)

We can't hardcode the list of extensions here because a devstack
plugin can be used with other devstack plugins.  This stuff
actually belongs to gate, where we know our exact configuration,
thus the list of extensions.

Also, skip fwaas v2 tempest tests for now.
(Otherwise v1 tempest job would fail.)

Closes-Bug: #1643844
Change-Id: I300e1eee1314440c22e2b30b683969b83e84ea5f
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS in fwaas devstack plugin"

This reverts commit 8bf87a0b0593d0a26604678c5c3ee170f251aa83.

Becauase setting NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS unconditionally
interferes other subprojects.  (networking-midonet gate is
broken due to this.)

We can't hardcode the list of extensions here because a devstack
plugin can be used with other devstack plugins.  This stuff
actually belongs to gate, where we know our exact configuration,
thus the list of extensions.

Also, skip fwaas v2 tempest tests for now.
(Otherwise v1 tempest job would fail.)

Closes-Bug: #1643844
Change-Id: I300e1eee1314440c22e2b30b683969b83e84ea5f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 12:51:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/fixture_data/keystone_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_version_discovery test

Something changed in requests/urllib3 library and now it sends
requests with url in a lower-case. It affects test_version_discovery
test because we use url in camel-case.

This patch changes test url to lower-case to be compatible with old

commit_message:
Fix test_version_discovery test

Something changed in requests/urllib3 library and now it sends
requests with url in a lower-case. It affects test_version_discovery
test because we use url in camel-case.

This patch changes test url to lower-case to be compatible with old
and new behaviours.

Change-Id: I4ae9715b124adb0a2e0115c9b00ab16576665f72
Closes-Bug: #1643874

commit_message:
Use mode 'http' in haproxy for ceilometer, neutron, aodh and gnocchi

HAProxy won't pass X-Forwarded-Proto to these services in mode tcp, so we need
to switch it to http in order for it to work and for the services to properly
set the protocol in the links they serve.

Change-Id: Ib10282159fb9269eebe81af23171ec9fb1297cd0
Closes-Bug: #1640126
(cherry picked from commit 255ea29cd425f096a22c000ecdc9e594cacdd36c)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-22 11:54:49.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/pacemaker_wrappers/manifests/rabbitmq.pp', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq-fuel', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': 'Disable HA for RPC queues by default

RPC wihout HA was tested on a big scale and we found that it greatly
reduces load OpenStack puts on RabbitMQ. Hence it is valuable to
disable it by default.

Closes-Bug: #1550303'}]
commit_message:
Disable HA for RPC queues by default

RPC wihout HA was tested on a big scale and we found that it greatly
reduces load OpenStack puts on RabbitMQ. Hence it is valuable to
disable it by default.

Change-Id: Iffa4173c2e6bb54e411defc7bdc44254669be5fd
Closes-Bug: #1550303

commit_message:
Handle security_groups setting

Set openvswitch firewall driver explicitly in dpdk case
on compute nodes otherwise get it from source of hiera.

Implements: blueprint security-groups-support-for-ovs
Change-Id: Ia4f927c6f4743d7f42bf3a0352295b97c9b56d3f

commit_message:
Add gate-quickstart role

This role lets arbitrary tripleo-quickstart and
tripleo-quickstart-extras changes be gated together through the
"Depends-On" mechanism.

Change-Id: If5b747b1bba17dd20efa9e7caee6fbc638dbb716

commit_message:
create a horizon plugin

Move vitragedashboard to vitrage-dashboard/dashboard
vitragealarms to vitrage-dashboard/alarms
vitragetemplates to vitrage-dashboard/templates
etc.

Enable to use this as horizon plugin without the need of
copying over API files, simply place files from enabled
directory in horizons openstack_dashboard/local/enabled
folder.

Change-Id: I38ea4e32abbad75e5432b8c1dfe64511162a7248

commit_message:
Use "cinder_api" as the backend name

"cinder_api" is used instead of "cinder-api" as the backend name in the haproxy
configuration. Ideally, we should not rely on names defined in the user
configuration, but we have no solution for this right now.

Change-Id: I09e484fc7a94852b62946928f22e7220597f5599

commit_message:
Use "nova_api" as the backend name

And similarly for nova-metadata-api and nova-novncproxy-websocket.

"nova_api" is used instead of "nova-api" as the backend name in the haproxy
configuration. Ideally, we should not rely on names defined in the user
configuration, but we have no solution for this right now.

Change-Id: Id4d6fb6788fedeb9cc15eddfe59a0ad4ddc32699

Use "keystone_public_api" as the backend name

And similarly for keystone-admin-api.

backend name in the haproxy configuration. Ideally, we should not rely
on names defined in the user configuration, but we have no solution for
this right now.

subject: Remove cmd from logging exception template
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-17 13:50:02.000000000', 'files': ['devops/helpers/exec_result.py', 'devops/tests/helpers/test_exec_result.py'], 'message': "Remove cmd from logging exception template

With current approach logging exceptions fails with KeyError if command
itself has curly braces. E.g. awk '{print $2}'.
We need to avoid such situations, since logging exceptions is crucial
for debugging.

+ Do not format template string with command in it, use concatenation instead
+ Add negative unittest for such case

Change-Id: I0570b9fe24e662b0542f6402a0a7a882508abc8d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove cmd from logging exception template

With current approach logging exceptions fails with KeyError if command
itself has curly braces. E.g. awk '{print $2}'.
We need to avoid such situations, since logging exceptions is crucial
for debugging.

+ Do not format template string with command in it, use concatenation instead
+ Add negative unittest for such case

Change-Id: I0570b9fe24e662b0542f6402a0a7a882508abc8d

subject: Reconnect to libvirt service if previous connection is lost
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-07 13:15:29.000000000', 'files': ['devops/driver/libvirt/libvirt_driver.py'], 'message': "Reconnect to libvirt service if previous connection is lost

re-trying a requiest doesn't help in cases when chached connection
was closed.

- do not cache the connection in a property
- check conn.isAlive() each time when already existing connection
  is picked

Closes-Bug:#1639788
Change-Id: I23c65162e32c97a03fc2950c41d13b83f350fee2
"}]
commit_message:
Reconnect to libvirt service if previous connection is lost

re-trying a requiest doesn't help in cases when chached connection
was closed.

- do not cache the connection in a property
- check conn.isAlive() each time when already existing connection
  is picked

Closes-Bug:#1639788
Change-Id: I23c65162e32c97a03fc2950c41d13b83f350fee2

- resume environment after revert by default

Change-Id: Ib11764ce712b1e9ffa59c71fa569463385cdf4e7
'}]
commit_message:
Retry requrest to libvirt in case of libvirt errors

- retry request to libvirt in cases when libvirt close connection
- suspend environment before snapshot by default
- resume environment after revert by default

Change-Id: Ib11764ce712b1e9ffa59c71fa569463385cdf4e7

commit_message:
Add missing volume snapshot skip

The following patch [1] that disables volume snapshots, fails with
the error: "'NfsDriver' object has no attribute 'create_snapshot'".
This patch adds the missing CONF.volume_feature_enabled.snapshot
skip to that test.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395887

Change-Id: I5ad578a78d6cfd4186a8230ad472d4a7b92445c9
Closes-Bug: #1640646

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 12:15:09.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/ironic_config.yml'], 'message': "playbooks: bifrost-ironic-install: Fix regexp for pxe_bootfile_name

The previous regexp never matched so a new pxe_bootfile_name was always
appended to the ironic.conf file. We fix this regular expression to
check for any character sequence after the '=' sign.

Change-Id: I9af9704f0ed750aa236c29b08bacd35a82960528
"}]
commit_message:
playbooks: bifrost-ironic-install: Fix regexp for pxe_bootfile_name

The previous regexp never matched so a new pxe_bootfile_name was always
appended to the ironic.conf file. We fix this regular expression to
check for any character sequence after the '=' sign.

Change-Id: I9af9704f0ed750aa236c29b08bacd35a82960528

subject: Allow server to be snapshot to be name, id or dict
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 23:39:14.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_image_snapshot.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Allow server to be snapshot to be name, id or dict

In documenting this method, it became clear we weren't telling people
what value server should have. Our tests made it look like it could be a
server name - but in fact it could actually only be a server dict or a
server id.

Make it explicitly all three, and fix the tests to not test their own
mocks. Or, if not actually fix them, at least make their examples not
blatantly wrong.

Change-Id: I64361a7a26cfa5137f9e862624fe379219f1cbb1
"}]
commit_message:
Allow server to be snapshot to be name, id or dict

In documenting this method, it became clear we weren't telling people
what value server should have. Our tests made it look like it could be a
server name - but in fact it could actually only be a server dict or a
server id.

Make it explicitly all three, and fix the tests to not test their own
mocks. Or, if not actually fix them, at least make their examples not
blatantly wrong.

Change-Id: I64361a7a26cfa5137f9e862624fe379219f1cbb1

commit_message:
Remove reboot task

This task isn't needed for example purposes but it indirectly conflicts
with other task which are cruicial for tests. These tasks create files
in /tmp but the reboot task makes them disappear.

Change-Id: Iff09fb84c04737813455cc7cc75502f14c992e90
Closes-Bug: #1625244

subject: Clean up docs around local registry
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-15 12:57:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/quickstart.rst', 'doc/multinode.rst', 'setup.cfg', 'doc/image-building.rst', 'tools/start-registry'], 'message': "Clean up docs around local registry

* Remove duplicated info between the 'image-building' and 'multinode'
  guides regarding deploying a local insecure registry.

* Add a helper script to easily start a local registry in a consistent
  way.

* Remove warnings around bugs in older registries, 2.3+ is now the
  default

* Remove references to running the local registry on port 4000, this
  causes confusion as Docker expects port 5000 by default unless
  specified, and registries are not required for all-in-one deployments
  anyhow.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I89f231df09102e3f1d5f21c8a8ca938ea60ae95b
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up docs around local registry

* Remove duplicated info between the 'image-building' and 'multinode'
  guides regarding deploying a local insecure registry.

* Add a helper script to easily start a local registry in a consistent
  way.

* Remove warnings around bugs in older registries, 2.3+ is now the
  default

* Remove references to running the local registry on port 4000, this
  causes confusion as Docker expects port 5000 by default unless
  specified, and registries are not required for all-in-one deployments
  anyhow.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I89f231df09102e3f1d5f21c8a8ca938ea60ae95b

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-22 00:24:13.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Release docker-py version constraint

The upper constraint of docker-py was limited because there is a
conflicted dependency issue [2]. The issue was fixed in docker-py

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/304296/

commit_message:
Release docker-py version constraint

The upper constraint of docker-py was limited because there is a
conflicted dependency issue [2]. The issue was fixed in docker-py
1.8.1 [3] so we can release the constraint now.

Note: This patch was proposed [4] in before, but it has been
reverted [5] due to an issue [6]. Now, the issue has been fixed
in docker-py [7], so I re-proposed this patch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/304296/
[2] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2870
[3] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/pull/1039
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/366948/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381780/
[6] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/issues/1155
[7] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/pull/1242

Change-Id: Ie233d54d42f09fc22983fe5627d111f0db8d6252

subject: DevStack: Use 'calico-1.4' PPA instead of 'kilo-testing'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 11:37:37.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "DevStack: Use 'calico-1.4' PPA instead of 'kilo-testing'

The DevStack plugin uses a PPA for two reasons:

- for the Calico dependencies that we don't build from source and that
  are not available in Ubuntu

- when running against OpenStack Kilo, to pick up Calico-modified Nova
  and Neutron packages.

Please note, in connection with the latter point, that from Liberty
onwards Calico works with vanilla Nova and Neutron - so that point
really is only needed when running with Kilo.

Ignoring the Nova and Neutron packages that are needed for Kilo point,
most of the PPAs at https://launchpad.net/~project-calico have identical
versions of the dependency packages that Calico needs.  However the
'calico-1.4' PPA has these packages for both Trusty and Xenial, whereas
'kilo-testing' only has them for Trusty.  As OpenStack CI jobs now need
to run on Xenial, we need to start using 'calico-1.4'.

It follows that we are temporarily losing the ability of the
networking-calico DevStack plugin to run against OpenStack Kilo (as
'calico-1.4' does not provide the Nova and Neutron packages that are
needed for Kilo).  However it is also the case that we currently have no
OpenStack CI for networking-calico against Kilo.  I hope to add that in
soon - after completing the transition of the master OpenStack CI to
Xenial - and will address the Kilo PPA point then (either by arranging
for the Kilo CI to run on Trusty, or by adding Xenial packages to
'kilo-testing').

Change-Id: I045be86e49f550139945f27d4cd5992079315ff7
"}]
commit_message:
DevStack: Use 'calico-1.4' PPA instead of 'kilo-testing'

The DevStack plugin uses a PPA for two reasons:

- for the Calico dependencies that we don't build from source and that
  are not available in Ubuntu

- when running against OpenStack Kilo, to pick up Calico-modified Nova
  and Neutron packages.

Please note, in connection with the latter point, that from Liberty
onwards Calico works with vanilla Nova and Neutron - so that point
really is only needed when running with Kilo.

Ignoring the Nova and Neutron packages that are needed for Kilo point,
most of the PPAs at https://launchpad.net/~project-calico have identical
versions of the dependency packages that Calico needs.  However the
'calico-1.4' PPA has these packages for both Trusty and Xenial, whereas
'kilo-testing' only has them for Trusty.  As OpenStack CI jobs now need
to run on Xenial, we need to start using 'calico-1.4'.

It follows that we are temporarily losing the ability of the
networking-calico DevStack plugin to run against OpenStack Kilo (as
'calico-1.4' does not provide the Nova and Neutron packages that are
needed for Kilo).  However it is also the case that we currently have no
OpenStack CI for networking-calico against Kilo.  I hope to add that in
soon - after completing the transition of the master OpenStack CI to
Xenial - and will address the Kilo PPA point then (either by arranging
for the Kilo CI to run on Trusty, or by adding Xenial packages to
'kilo-testing').

Change-Id: I045be86e49f550139945f27d4cd5992079315ff7

subject: Enable CADF notification format by default
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-11-21 19:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/conf/default.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/common/test_notifications.py', 'releasenotes/notes/enable-cadf-notification-format-by-default-f938267e1ec54071.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable CADF notification format by default

The current default notification format is set to ``basic``, the home-brewed
openstack-styled format.  Since all new notifications have adhered to the
CADF format, we should switch to use CADF format by default, which provides
compatibility with the older format.

Also, messages for the following authentication events are squelched due
to their chattiness:

* identity.authenticate.success
* identity.authenticate.pending
* identity.authenticate.failed

Change-Id: I6dd3a52319bd59aa5ef856e6d99b5a1d7c37e371
Closes-Bug: #1641660
'}]
commit_message:
Enable CADF notification format by default

The current default notification format is set to ``basic``, the home-brewed
openstack-styled format.  Since all new notifications have adhered to the
CADF format, we should switch to use CADF format by default, which provides
compatibility with the older format.

Also, messages for the following authentication events are squelched due
to their chattiness:

* identity.authenticate.success
* identity.authenticate.pending
* identity.authenticate.failed

Change-Id: I6dd3a52319bd59aa5ef856e6d99b5a1d7c37e371
Closes-Bug: #1641660

commit_message:
Cleanup service usage

oslo_service Service usage in the engine was slightly wrong: we
inherited from the base class without using its threadgroup, and we also
inherited from it in utility classes that were not real services. This
cleans up those.

Change-Id: I0f902afb2b4fb03c579d071f9b502e3108aa460a

If a server performs a very slow operations with network devices,
libvirt can raise an exception when destroy a domain.
However, domain is actually destroyed.

Make a workaround to continue with other domains.

Related-Bug:#1641568

Change-Id: I0c38dd1977b410723a530724d34fe2ac231cf0b3
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for LP#1641568

If a server performs a very slow operations with network devices,
libvirt can raise an exception when destroy a domain.
However, domain is actually destroyed.

Make a workaround to continue with other domains.

Related-Bug:#1641568

Change-Id: I0c38dd1977b410723a530724d34fe2ac231cf0b3

commit_message:
[sahara] scenario jobs: jobs modifications

1. sahara-tests in branchless repository and scenario
jobs are running only on master of sahara. using xenial for
that.
2. since in Ocata n-net is going to be almost removed, removing
job for that in sahara-tests.
3. moving job for saharaclient to voting state.

Change-Id: I24ba412f3481ce957ea0e48523f5b3dd252daba2

commit_message:
Add processing for old-style roles meta

We shouldn't break backward compatibility for old-style plugins
and release metadata. The idea is to put so-called tag into role
tags if this field doesn't exist, also, tag should inherit role's
'has_primary' property.

Change-Id: I66de62948d01cb265b789460585f943c2dd80ba8
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition

subject: Set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS in fwaas devstack plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 15:38:45.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "Set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS in fwaas devstack plugin

The NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS environment variable needs to be controlled
so that the fwaas or fwaas_v2 extensions can be properly added.  This is
necessary because the tempest tests for v1 and v2 trigger based on what
extensions are loaded.  Without this, NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS would
default to 'all', and the fwaas_v2 tests would run when fwaas v1 is
loaded and vice versa.

Change-Id: I12d765c38c1cfc7c397fef4497e9f11f260f4517
Needed-By: I8b8ddf2a9cc4d2f18c4b32917630c2a26ee0d713
Needed-By: I9fc39c5adcf136fce520c329f48cbad60cd21861
"}]
commit_message:
Set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS in fwaas devstack plugin

The NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS environment variable needs to be controlled
so that the fwaas or fwaas_v2 extensions can be properly added.  This is
necessary because the tempest tests for v1 and v2 trigger based on what
extensions are loaded.  Without this, NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS would
default to 'all', and the fwaas_v2 tests would run when fwaas v1 is
loaded and vice versa.

Change-Id: I12d765c38c1cfc7c397fef4497e9f11f260f4517
Needed-By: I8b8ddf2a9cc4d2f18c4b32917630c2a26ee0d713
Needed-By: I9fc39c5adcf136fce520c329f48cbad60cd21861

subject: refactor notification test to work with either format
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-20 12:46:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/common/test_notifications.py'], 'message': 'refactor notification test to work with either format

The _test_notification_operation function only works with the
`basic` notification format.

For the `cadf` format to work, it is necessary to mock the
_create_cadf_payload call.

Change-Id: I982fcead0f6cb89a13057ee5275087d2e32612cc
Related-Bug: #1641660
'}]
commit_message:
refactor notification test to work with either format

The _test_notification_operation function only works with the
`basic` notification format.

For the `cadf` format to work, it is necessary to mock the
_create_cadf_payload call.

Change-Id: I982fcead0f6cb89a13057ee5275087d2e32612cc
Related-Bug: #1641660

subject: Add 'options' to OpenStackCharm class
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-22 11:10:14.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_charms_openstack_charm.py', 'charms_openstack/adapters.py', 'unit_tests/test_charms_openstack_adapters.py', 'charms_openstack/test_utils.py', 'charms_openstack/charm.py'], 'message': "Add 'options' to OpenStackCharm class

This changeset adds an 'options' property to the OpenStackCharm
class that is evaluated/added when the class is created.  This
enables the OpenStackCharm derived class to access computed
options as well as the config from the config.yaml.

Addtional changes are to simplify testing (and the need to mock)
by delaying instantiating or evaluating properties/members on
the the class during the __init__() method.  This means that
they are lazily evaluated which also helps with hook performance
if the property is not used during that hook invocation.

Change-Id: If6d103b4f62c95b0fa76562a18e418e0d319e987
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'options' to OpenStackCharm class

This changeset adds an 'options' property to the OpenStackCharm
class that is evaluated/added when the class is created.  This
enables the OpenStackCharm derived class to access computed
options as well as the config from the config.yaml.

Addtional changes are to simplify testing (and the need to mock)
by delaying instantiating or evaluating properties/members on
the the class during the __init__() method.  This means that
they are lazily evaluated which also helps with hook performance
if the property is not used during that hook invocation.

Change-Id: If6d103b4f62c95b0fa76562a18e418e0d319e987

subject: Temporary push rights for tripleo-quickstart repos
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 11:30:35.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/tripleo-quickstart.config'], 'message': 'Temporary push rights for tripleo-quickstart repos

The recently created tripleo-quickstart-extras repository will consists
of several pre-existing ansible roles. We want to save history and
attribution by merging their commit history in the new repository.

This requires a temporary push, push merge commit and forge commiter

prepared history.

Change-Id: Ia8736843fc2e5a94842398b0669ecde72c9543ee
'}]
commit_message:
Temporary push rights for tripleo-quickstart repos

The recently created tripleo-quickstart-extras repository will consists
of several pre-existing ansible roles. We want to save history and
attribution by merging their commit history in the new repository.

This requires a temporary push, push merge commit and forge commiter
right. These changes will be reverted after pushing the already
prepared history.

Change-Id: Ia8736843fc2e5a94842398b0669ecde72c9543ee

subject: Use mode 'http' in haproxy for ceilometer, neutron, aodh and gnocchi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 08:32:35.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Use mode 'http' in haproxy for ceilometer, neutron, aodh and gnocchi

HAProxy won't pass X-Forwarded-Proto to these services in mode tcp, so we need
to switch it to http in order for it to work and for the services to properly
set the protocol in the links they serve.

Change-Id: Ib10282159fb9269eebe81af23171ec9fb1297cd0
Closes-Bug: #1640126
"}]
commit_message:
Use mode 'http' in haproxy for ceilometer, neutron, aodh and gnocchi

HAProxy won't pass X-Forwarded-Proto to these services in mode tcp, so we need
to switch it to http in order for it to work and for the services to properly
set the protocol in the links they serve.

Change-Id: Ib10282159fb9269eebe81af23171ec9fb1297cd0
Closes-Bug: #1640126

commit_message:
Catch NotFound exception when query tenant info

When query tenant info, the instances retrieved can be
deleted at any time. so api layer need catch that exception.

Change-Id: I8a11e28ac5c7526565599008dfe7b5e11fe5adfb
Closes-Bug: 1643444

commit_message:
Corrected test environment

Moved what were called unit tests to the functional directory as there is
more work to be done to make them self supporting.
Added sphinx to the test-requirements along with testr deps.
Adjusted the tox.ini to suit.
Added doc source tree with the minimal set of files to allow sphinx
success.

Change-Id: Ic64c2ccd01778bb0d1142d12ca43b2346bdc7aa7

commit_message:
Fix default retries parameters for shell tasks

Use shell specific parameters shell_retries and shell_interval,
instead of mc_retries and mc_interval which are used for retries
if node was not accesible via MCollective.

Closes-bug: #1641198
Change-Id: I04a4d187ab3aa4cde46b2775766eb88babd46ab7

commit_message:
Refactoring of the override_resources type for the IaC feature

This commit changes override_resources type allowing to
- specify any puppet resource
- pass any number of resources

It also introduces the logic to decide whether override_resources
should create a new resource, if it hasn't been found in the catalog.

The resource overrides as well as additional settings are taken from
Hiera.

This logic essentially allows to create any Puppet resource via
passing the right hash to the Hiera. It replaces/extends the old
'Advanced configuration' feature.

Change-Id: I81099ac41c3e2abdaf6fde3a19161709b7ba4b8c
Blueprint: puppet-resource-override

subject: Notify if metrics are not defined or not added for hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 17:19:37.000000000', 'files': ['freezer_dr/monitors/common/manager.py', 'freezer_dr/monitors/common/driver.py', 'freezer_dr/monitors/drivers/monasca/driver.py', 'freezer_dr/notifiers/drivers/default/default_email.py', 'freezer_dr/monitors/drivers/default/driver.py', 'freezer_dr/monitors/drivers/dummy/driver.py', 'freezer_dr/main.py', 'freezer_dr/notifiers/common/manager.py', 'freezer_dr/notifiers/common/driver.py'], 'message': 'Notify if metrics are not defined or not added for hosts

Now Monitoring driver is getting notifier instance to be used
in case of failure get data for a certain metric or failed to find
the metric added on a certain host, the notifier will be used to
notify admins list (notify-list in config file) that something is
wrong with the metrics and need to look at it

Base notification driver changed to support the following methods:

1. notify_status: will be used to notify if node is failed and
   evacuated
2. notify: will be used anywhere in monitoring drivers to notify
administrators if something is wrong.

Change-Id: I12eddf03d1921a04f5fa9a8101a471bea5f9c507
'}]
commit_message:
Notify if metrics are not defined or not added for hosts

Now Monitoring driver is getting notifier instance to be used
in case of failure get data for a certain metric or failed to find
the metric added on a certain host, the notifier will be used to
notify admins list (notify-list in config file) that something is
wrong with the metrics and need to look at it

Base notification driver changed to support the following methods:

1. notify_status: will be used to notify if node is failed and
   evacuated
2. notify: will be used anywhere in monitoring drivers to notify
administrators if something is wrong.

Change-Id: I12eddf03d1921a04f5fa9a8101a471bea5f9c507

subject: Set timeout for resource which is used to wrap shell tasks.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 09:02:47.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/tasks/shell_task_spec.rb', 'lib/astute/tasks/shell.rb'], 'message': 'Set timeout for resource which is used to wrap shell tasks.

Slow tasks fail, because default timeout for `exec` resource
is 300 seconds. The patch passes timeout from the task to
puppet wrapper.

Closes-bug: #1641190
Change-Id: I8f7c2120e61144911481c83b0da391e30bbc6f2f
'}]
commit_message:
Set timeout for resource which is used to wrap shell tasks.

Slow tasks fail, because default timeout for `exec` resource
is 300 seconds. The patch passes timeout from the task to
puppet wrapper.

Closes-bug: #1641190
Change-Id: I8f7c2120e61144911481c83b0da391e30bbc6f2f

commit_message:
Use constraints in all tox targets

Since August[1] the OpenStack infrastructure now supports constraints
in all jobs, so lets use them here.

This shoudl fix issues like [2]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/71/71a4e63a6cf159a4e5e814a609eafaf5b447cf88/release/heat-docs-ubuntu-xenial/4f407d9/console.html#_2016-11-22_03_35_49_864882

commit_message:
Use logging.warning instead of logging.warn

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3.
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I84308ef2aaec5985c46b05b22397803e54c4d93a

commit_message:
add odl-server service in devstack for networking-odl multinode job

As highlighted by [1] in a multinode networking-odl Gate job
odl-server or odl-neutron parameter has to be set as per [2].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/26/396526/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl-multinode-carbon-snapshot-nv/50562f0/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2016-11-12_01_30_11_309
[2] https://github.com/openstack/networking-odl/blob/ac2bd31ed912220ffc29ed32be4dd9c661494e20/devstack/settings#L6

Change-Id: I0fc1b3202397c8431676de47bef466f79c62496b
Co-Authored-By: Waldemar Znoinski <waldemar.znoinski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix interface update

When updating interface attributes
it is necessary to merge data from nailgun
agent with those that are in the database
instead of just updating them.

Change-Id: I5c20f66e8a7cc0c0de9974508de458672b46840e
Closes-Bug: #1627776

subject: devstack: make tempest timeout longer
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-22 06:24:01.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/devstackgaterc'], 'message': "devstack: make tempest timeout longer

As tempest test is run serially and we're adding scenario tests,
we're occasionally hitting timeout of 120 mins.
For now as work around, make timeout a bit longer to 180 mins.
In near future(Ocata cycle) after migrating to new ODL
netvirt(vpnservice), this parallel execution should be enabled
and this work around should be removed.

Change-Id: I758de9600e18a817cbd2eeeb71a5e4fbee83090b
"}]
commit_message:
devstack: make tempest timeout longer

As tempest test is run serially and we're adding scenario tests,
we're occasionally hitting timeout of 120 mins.
For now as work around, make timeout a bit longer to 180 mins.
In near future(Ocata cycle) after migrating to new ODL
netvirt(vpnservice), this parallel execution should be enabled
and this work around should be removed.

Change-Id: I758de9600e18a817cbd2eeeb71a5e4fbee83090b

commit_message:
Correct AllNodesDeploySteps depends_on

This is wrong atm, it should loop to create a list for the depends_on
not multiple depends_on statements.

Note this was first corrected in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330659/
but we need it as a standalone patch that can be backported.

Change-Id: I4d1d6346f2147e573fc0900038f1ad1d782e75ee
Closes-Bug: #1642069

by the issue https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/3182

subject: Fix Offloading class not to generate different has sum
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-22 09:04:47.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': 'Fix Offloading class not to generate different has sum

Objects from Offloading class are used to calculate checksums for
Nailgun, without `to_s` object id is used, which is every time different.

Change-Id: I07e9c3d0a88e7a674b0eeab8dc23f20987fedea6
Closes-bug: #1643008
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Offloading class not to generate different has sum

Objects from Offloading class are used to calculate checksums for
Nailgun, without `to_s` object id is used, which is every time different.

Change-Id: I07e9c3d0a88e7a674b0eeab8dc23f20987fedea6
Closes-bug: #1643008

Check command let you to figure out can you update env for release or not.

Usage:
    octane check [--requirements] [--health] [--functional] [--all] ENV_ID RELEASE_ID

commit_message:
Add command for check upgrade

Check command let you to figure out can you update env for release or not.

Usage:
    octane check [--requirements] [--health] [--functional] [--all] ENV_ID RELEASE_ID

Change-Id: I428579285d5e3b2806e7aedea564d4a1b099e8d7

Stop ceph mon in orig env on extract conf

In moment when archive making we stop mon.
This prevernt error state in `tar` command `file changed as we read it`

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-25 10:19:51.000000000', 'files': ['octane/handlers/backup_restore/puppet.py', 'octane/tests/test_archivators_restore.py'], 'message': 'Close fd created by mkstemp

In PuppetApplyHost archivator file descriptor returned by mkstemp is ignored
and thus remains open after function finishes.

Change-Id: Ief11db89680082bec10da161277fdf1b2ff436a3
Closes-bug: 1572918
(cherry picked from commit 34ece032c93df372e781dba1fc18f516e73d04b9)
'}]
commit_message:
Close fd created by mkstemp

In PuppetApplyHost archivator file descriptor returned by mkstemp is ignored
and thus remains open after function finishes.

Change-Id: Ief11db89680082bec10da161277fdf1b2ff436a3
Closes-bug: 1572918
(cherry picked from commit 34ece032c93df372e781dba1fc18f516e73d04b9)

subject: Properly handle shared storage in case of cold migrations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 17:04:07.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_migrationops.py', 'hyperv/nova/migrationops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py'], 'message': "Properly handle shared storage in case of cold migrations

At the moment, if the destination host is other than the source
host, we attempt to move the instance files without checking if
shared storage is being used.

This change fixes this issue. In case of shared storage, we'll have
the same workflow as when the migration source is the migration
destination as well.

Closes-Bug: #1565895

Change-Id: I711976b42a5de5a28de22e010b48c10d96b68ba5
(cherry picked from commit 60c06bdd6fc006d6bff6840efdc8438de37f983d)
"}]
commit_message:
Properly handle shared storage in case of cold migrations

At the moment, if the destination host is other than the source
host, we attempt to move the instance files without checking if
shared storage is being used.

This change fixes this issue. In case of shared storage, we'll have
the same workflow as when the migration source is the migration
destination as well.

Closes-Bug: #1565895

Change-Id: I711976b42a5de5a28de22e010b48c10d96b68ba5
(cherry picked from commit 60c06bdd6fc006d6bff6840efdc8438de37f983d)

subject: Properly handle shared storage during live migration
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-28 10:30:09.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/livemigrationops.py', 'hyperv/nova/driver.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/cluster/test_livemigrationops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_driver.py', 'hyperv/nova/cluster/livemigrationops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_livemigrationops.py'], 'message': "Properly handle shared storage during live migration

After a live migration is performed, we always try to delete the
instance files.

If the migration fails, the destination node is not cleaned up as
the HyperVLiveMigrateData object is not used at the moment and the
nova compute manager won't know whether a cleanup is needed or not.

Also, in order to support using CSVs for storing instance files, we
need to explicitly specify whether image files will be migrated or not
when requesting os-win to migrate the VM.

This change addresses those issues.

Depends-On: I48dc6da29534bf0c477c742311ac15438d8b63ad

Change-Id: Icf2f258ef8900b5970ff153a7b981ee53e58dd2d
Partial-Bug: #1565895
"}]
commit_message:
Properly handle shared storage during live migration

After a live migration is performed, we always try to delete the
instance files.

If the migration fails, the destination node is not cleaned up as
the HyperVLiveMigrateData object is not used at the moment and the
nova compute manager won't know whether a cleanup is needed or not.

Also, in order to support using CSVs for storing instance files, we
need to explicitly specify whether image files will be migrated or not
when requesting os-win to migrate the VM.

This change addresses those issues.

Depends-On: I48dc6da29534bf0c477c742311ac15438d8b63ad

Change-Id: Icf2f258ef8900b5970ff153a7b981ee53e58dd2d
Partial-Bug: #1565895

subject: Fix image handling when shared storage is being used
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-23 13:53:34.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/imagecache.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_imagecache.py'], 'message': 'Fix image handling when shared storage is being used

The image cache operation uses thread locks, for which reason it is
prone to race conditions when using shared storage. This is avoided
by using file locks, placed on the shared path.

Change-Id: I2b002993b7ab0973960794bfdd81d4fe57bf7399
Partial-Bug: #1565895
'}]
commit_message:
Fix image handling when shared storage is being used

The image cache operation uses thread locks, for which reason it is
prone to race conditions when using shared storage. This is avoided
by using file locks, placed on the shared path.

Change-Id: I2b002993b7ab0973960794bfdd81d4fe57bf7399
Partial-Bug: #1565895

subject: Set trusts_delegated_roles to [] in engine.pp
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-19 01:55:05.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/engine.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_engine_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Set trusts_delegated_roles to [] in engine.pp

Configure $trusts_delegated_roles=['heat_stack_owner'] would get
an error message from cli and 400 with API.

The default value of "trusts_delegated_roles" option in heat.conf
has changed to [] since Kilo.

change [] to $::os_service_default

Modified heat_engine_spec.rb.

Change-Id: Ica608619a17d9b59982207879a5643716630db83
Closes-Bug: #1634361
'}]
commit_message:
Set trusts_delegated_roles to [] in engine.pp

Configure $trusts_delegated_roles=['heat_stack_owner'] would get
an error message from cli and 400 with API.

The default value of "trusts_delegated_roles" option in heat.conf
has changed to [] since Kilo.

change [] to $::os_service_default

Modified heat_engine_spec.rb.

Change-Id: Ica608619a17d9b59982207879a5643716630db83
Closes-Bug: #1634361

subject: Remove info from the log message about retries for suceed tasks.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-11 18:44:57.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/puppet_job.rb'], 'message': "Remove info from the log message about retries for suceed tasks.

Sometimes engineers missread the message, it's not obvious
that there such a thing as succeed_retries, so it's read
as a message of failed task which does not have more
retries.

Closes-bug: #1641194
Change-Id: I948996fcb8054a2bde27a9de7c7cac650b3c2b8c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove info from the log message about retries for suceed tasks.

Sometimes engineers missread the message, it's not obvious
that there such a thing as succeed_retries, so it's read
as a message of failed task which does not have more
retries.

Closes-bug: #1641194
Change-Id: I948996fcb8054a2bde27a9de7c7cac650b3c2b8c

if one existed. This was a byproduct of the old oslo-incubator

Change-Id: I0603d3c1419a5344bee8e43cfbe794c26641960a

commit_message:
move old oslo-incubator code out of openstack/common

As part of the first community-wide goal, teams were asked
to remove the openstack/common package of their projects
if one existed. This was a byproduct of the old oslo-incubator
form of syncing common functionality.

The package, apiclient, was moved to a top level location
and cliutils was moved to the common module. There are no oslo
specific libraries, the recommended solution is to move it
in tree and maintain it there.

Change-Id: I0603d3c1419a5344bee8e43cfbe794c26641960a

commit_message:
Set timeout for resource which is used to wrap shell tasks.

Slow tasks fail, because default timeout for `exec` resource
is 300 seconds. The patch passes timeout from the task to
puppet wrapper.

Closes-bug: #1641190
Change-Id: I8f7c2120e61144911481c83b0da391e30bbc6f2f

commit_message:
Fix Offloading class not to generate different has sum

Objects from Offloading class are used to calculate checksums for
Nailgun, without `to_s` object id is used, which is every time different.

Change-Id: I07e9c3d0a88e7a674b0eeab8dc23f20987fedea6
Closes-bug: #1643008

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 16:59:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Use byte string or utf8 depending on python version for wsgi

A recent change to the wsgi code broke deployments running over
httpd/mod_wsgi. This is because for py2.X mod_wsgi accepts byte
strings and breaks with utf8. However, for py3.X, utf8 is
accepted. So this acts accordingly.

Change-Id: I81739bc3de9d623b718987b5fc18eaf851533902
Closes-Bug: #1643511
'}]
commit_message:
Use byte string or utf8 depending on python version for wsgi

A recent change to the wsgi code broke deployments running over
httpd/mod_wsgi. This is because for py2.X mod_wsgi accepts byte
strings and breaks with utf8. However, for py3.X, utf8 is
accepted. So this acts accordingly.

Change-Id: I81739bc3de9d623b718987b5fc18eaf851533902
Closes-Bug: #1643511

commit_message:
Support icalendar time format without the crontab mentions

Sometimes,crontab could not meet some complex situation.but Ical can
meet all use cases at present and we can use it instead of crontab.

Change-Id: I8acdbfc844b4610a47272f4f97d9d3f385e5f27f
Closes-Bug: #1613577

subject: Expose OVS bridge related options into metering agent config file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 11:15:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/opts.py', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/l3_agent.ini', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/dhcp_agent.ini', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/metering_agent.ini', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Expose OVS bridge related options into metering agent config file

Agent state options (report_interval), or interface related options
(f.e. ovs_integration_bridge) should be exposed into all configuration
files for all agents that may report a state, or instantiate a bridge
object.

Since some of options that were previously considered 'base' don't apply
to metering agent (specifically, availability_zone), moved them into
separate lists and included them into relevant agents (l3 and dhcp).

The only glitch with the change is that log_agent_heartbeats option is
now exposed into metering agent configuration file, even though the
agent does not honour it. I think it's minor and we can live with it.

Change-Id: Ibceca20cec60e75a8c6ddd35f3f9cb8cca272a9e
"}]
commit_message:
Expose OVS bridge related options into metering agent config file

Agent state options (report_interval), or interface related options
(f.e. ovs_integration_bridge) should be exposed into all configuration
files for all agents that may report a state, or instantiate a bridge
object.

Since some of options that were previously considered 'base' don't apply
to metering agent (specifically, availability_zone), moved them into
separate lists and included them into relevant agents (l3 and dhcp).

The only glitch with the change is that log_agent_heartbeats option is
now exposed into metering agent configuration file, even though the
agent does not honour it. I think it's minor and we can live with it.

Change-Id: Ibceca20cec60e75a8c6ddd35f3f9cb8cca272a9e

commit_message:
Move common variables to common.yml

This patch creates a common.yml variables file to hold variables
that apply to all distributions supported by the role. It also adds
comments into the existing vars file to instruct developers and
deployers about the proper location for variables.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Idad1cbfe0c6992a6333c4740080764a3ac776628

commit_message:
Move AgentStatusCheckWorker to PeriodicWorker

Renames the AgentStatusCheckWorker class to PeriodicWorker
and moves it into the worker module since there isn't anything
agent-specific about it and it can be used for other periodic
jobs server side.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ic7a55ef534f64e6bfc60ae38bb0e139a0078510b

subject: Fix the required package variable name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 18:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/var-rename-required-pip-packages-632851ef8137a4a1.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_install.yml'], 'message': "Fix the required package variable name

The variable 'gnocchi_required_pip_packages' is incorrectly named,
resulting in the potential for the packages in the list not being
built in the repo build and causing other issues with anything
that uses that pattern to find the package list.

This patch corrects the variable name to match the pattern across
all other roles.

Change-Id: Ie636dfeb4497c8d3703977bd55d53d1efba7d539
(cherry picked from commit b1f6e79ca37b9043bb163f24b9dc1bb593632d87)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the required package variable name

The variable 'gnocchi_required_pip_packages' is incorrectly named,
resulting in the potential for the packages in the list not being
built in the repo build and causing other issues with anything
that uses that pattern to find the package list.

This patch corrects the variable name to match the pattern across
all other roles.

Change-Id: Ie636dfeb4497c8d3703977bd55d53d1efba7d539
(cherry picked from commit b1f6e79ca37b9043bb163f24b9dc1bb593632d87)

commit_message:
Optimize time trigger: use instance of time format instead of class itself

Optimize time trigger in several aspects. This patch is the fourth
phase, which will use an instance of time format in time trigger
instead of class.

Closes-Bug: #1611232

commit_message:
[Tempest] Port remote_client into Manila

Manila tempest tests make use of remote_client [1], which won't be making it
to the tempest stable interfaces, as it imports tempest code which would
result in a circular dependency.

This commit ports a reduced version of remote_client into manila code in
order to have manila's tempest plugin to drop the dependency on it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py

Partially-Implements: bp/tempest-no-deps

Change-Id: I97a8c57adce9cd541766cc1a2f21ca9ceb92efe9

subject: Fix fact gathering when using --limit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 11:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/site.yml'], 'message': 'Fix fact gathering when using --limit

If an operator wants to deploy a single node (e.g. add an additional
compute), they may want to use the --limit feature of Ansible to avoid
waiting for every play across every node.

The problem with this is that --limit will gather facts for that node
only, causing template errors such as the infamous ('dict object' has no
attribute u'ansible_eth0'").

Ansible has catered to this problem to an extent with it's
"delegate_facts" mechanism. The only problem is that in the default 'all
nodes' case, we end up with a storm of SSHs as each node SSHs to every
other. I'm solving this with a separate task to only use this mechanism
when a subset of nodes has been specified (see ansible_play_batch).

Useful links on this subject:
- https://medium.com/@george.shuklin/perfecting-forced-fact-gathering-in-ansible-1611f9c8d0d5#.tr5zs3e7x
- http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#delegated-facts

Change-Id: Ibb691eae15cacd9e5129ae9280fd296f5ba95940
Closes-Bug: 1642004
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fact gathering when using --limit

If an operator wants to deploy a single node (e.g. add an additional
compute), they may want to use the --limit feature of Ansible to avoid
waiting for every play across every node.

The problem with this is that --limit will gather facts for that node
only, causing template errors such as the infamous ('dict object' has no
attribute u'ansible_eth0'").

Ansible has catered to this problem to an extent with it's
"delegate_facts" mechanism. The only problem is that in the default 'all
nodes' case, we end up with a storm of SSHs as each node SSHs to every
other. I'm solving this with a separate task to only use this mechanism
when a subset of nodes has been specified (see ansible_play_batch).

Useful links on this subject:
- https://medium.com/@george.shuklin/perfecting-forced-fact-gathering-in-ansible-1611f9c8d0d5#.tr5zs3e7x
- http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#delegated-facts

Change-Id: Ibb691eae15cacd9e5129ae9280fd296f5ba95940
Closes-Bug: 1642004

commit_message:
breaking down tests.py into smaller pieces

tests.py is currently at ~5500 lines of code, it's
time to break it down into smaller files.

I started with an easy middleware set of tests
(i.e., versioned writes, ~600 lines of code ) so I can get
some feedback. There are more complicated tests that cover
multiple middlewares for example, it is not so clear where
those should go.

Change-Id: I2aa6c18ee5b68d0aae73cc6add8cac6fbf7f33da
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4656, 'name': 'Sean M. Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-21 14:19:11.000000000', 'files': ['tools/fixup_stuff.sh'], 'message': 'Force reinstall of virtualenv to ensure installation is valid

On RHEL-based systems pip and yum share the same installation
directory for virtualenv.  If yum pulls in the python-virtualenv
package (e.g. due to a dependency) it will clobber what pip has
already installed. The file tools/fixup_stuff.sh tries to ensure that
the proper virtualenv package is installed via pip. If virtualenv has
already been installed via pip, then clobbered by yum, pip skips the
install since it appears as if virtualenv is already installed and at
the correct version.

The reinstall of virtualenv must use the --force-reinstall argument to
pip to fix up the damage done by yum.

Change-Id: Ib0edf6c4ee8a510e9d671213de35d787f56acfed
Closes-Bug: #1599863
'}]
commit_message:
Force reinstall of virtualenv to ensure installation is valid

On RHEL-based systems pip and yum share the same installation
directory for virtualenv.  If yum pulls in the python-virtualenv
package (e.g. due to a dependency) it will clobber what pip has
already installed. The file tools/fixup_stuff.sh tries to ensure that
the proper virtualenv package is installed via pip. If virtualenv has
already been installed via pip, then clobbered by yum, pip skips the
install since it appears as if virtualenv is already installed and at
the correct version.

The reinstall of virtualenv must use the --force-reinstall argument to
pip to fix up the damage done by yum.

Change-Id: Ib0edf6c4ee8a510e9d671213de35d787f56acfed
Closes-Bug: #1599863

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I881d7e9a12a7bf9ff10eefe4c72ab21b261714ee
Closes-bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Add profiling support to Zaqar client

To be able to create profiling traces for Zaqar, client should be
able to send special HTTP header that contains trace info. This
patch is as well important to be able to make cross project traces.
(Typical case end user calls Zaqar via OpenStack python client,
if profiler is initialized, Zaqar client will add extra header,
that will be parsed by special osprofiler middleware at server side)

Don't worry no security issue here, trace information is signed
by HMAC key that is setted in config file at server side. So only
person that knows HMAC key is able to send proper header.

Zaqar server patch is: I32565de6c447cd5e95a0ef54a9fbd4e571c2d820

Currently there are some projects are using osprofiler, like Glance,
Cinder, Heat, and some others are working in progress, e.g. Trove.

Implements: blueprint osprofiler
Change-Id: I880c003511e9e4ef99806ba5b19d0ef6996be80b
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 41, 'created': '2016-11-18 08:33:31.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/common/configs.py', 'zaqar/storage/sqlalchemy/driver.py', 'zaqar/storage/pipeline.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'zaqar/tests/base.py', 'zaqar/tests/unit/common/storage/test_utils.py', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/zaqar.conf', 'zaqar/bootstrap.py', 'requirements.txt', 'zaqar/profile.py', 'zaqar/transport/wsgi/driver.py', 'zaqar/storage/mongodb/driver.py', 'zaqar/storage/utils.py', 'zaqar/storage/pooling.py', 'zaqar/storage/redis/driver.py'], 'message': 'Integrate OSprofiler with Zaqar

*) Add osprofiler wsgi middleware
This middleware is used for 2 things:
1) It checks that person who want to trace is trusted and knows
secret HMAC key.
2) It start tracing in case of proper trace headers
and add first wsgi trace point, with info about HTTP request.

*) Add initialization of osprofiler at start of server
Initialize and set an oslo.messaging based notifier instance
to osprofiler which be used to send notifications to Ceilometer.

*) Enable profile on existing useful storage backends
Change controller creation logic of data and control panel for
mongodb, redis and sqlalchemy storage backends, as well as
an aggregative pooling driver.

*) Add options to allow operator control profiles separately

NOTE to test this:
1) You have to enable necessary profiler option(s) base on your needed.
2) You need to enable follow services in localrc for devstack:
  CEILOMETER_NOTIFICATION_TOPICS=notifications,profiler
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-acompute,ceilometer-acentral
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-anotification,ceilometer-collector
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-alarm-evaluator,ceilometer-alarm-notifier
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-api
3) You should use python-zaqarclient with this change:
  I880c003511e9e4ef99806ba5b19d0ef6996be80b

Run any command with --os-profile <SECRET_KEY>
  $ openstack --os-profile <SECRET_KEY> queue list
  # it will print <Trace ID>
Get pretty HTML with traces:
  $ osprofiler trace show --html <Trace ID>
note that osprofiler should be run from admin user name & tenant.

DocImpact

Partially-implements BP: osprofiler
Change-Id: I32565de6c447cd5e95a0ef54a9fbd4e571c2d820
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Integrate OSprofiler with Zaqar

*) Add osprofiler wsgi middleware
This middleware is used for 2 things:
1) It checks that person who want to trace is trusted and knows
secret HMAC key.
2) It start tracing in case of proper trace headers
and add first wsgi trace point, with info about HTTP request.

*) Add initialization of osprofiler at start of server
Initialize and set an oslo.messaging based notifier instance
to osprofiler which be used to send notifications to Ceilometer.

*) Enable profile on existing useful storage backends
Change controller creation logic of data and control panel for
mongodb, redis and sqlalchemy storage backends, as well as
an aggregative pooling driver.

*) Add options to allow operator control profiles separately

NOTE to test this:
1) You have to enable necessary profiler option(s) base on your needed.
2) You need to enable follow services in localrc for devstack:
  CEILOMETER_NOTIFICATION_TOPICS=notifications,profiler
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-acompute,ceilometer-acentral
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-anotification,ceilometer-collector
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-alarm-evaluator,ceilometer-alarm-notifier
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-api
3) You should use python-zaqarclient with this change:
  I880c003511e9e4ef99806ba5b19d0ef6996be80b

Run any command with --os-profile <SECRET_KEY>
  $ openstack --os-profile <SECRET_KEY> queue list
  # it will print <Trace ID>
Get pretty HTML with traces:
  $ osprofiler trace show --html <Trace ID>
note that osprofiler should be run from admin user name & tenant.

DocImpact

Partially-implements BP: osprofiler
Change-Id: I32565de6c447cd5e95a0ef54a9fbd4e571c2d820
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>

They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

commit_message:
Stop using osprofiler options as if they are part of public API

Options are for operators, not for the code. We should switch to public
functions provided by the library, to get what we want.

Change-Id: Id124dc6743d83c62d264ecc6b01a6b4006e44f35

tools: catch up neutron-lbaas change

commit_message:
Remove oslo-incubator use in other client plugins

oslo incubator code is planned to be removed from the clients
this cycle. Remove the redundant usage of it from other client
plugins.

This also includes an unrelated change(to remove the vpnaas
post configuration, as we have removed the plugin from the
gate jobs), to fix the gate.

Last but not least, it limits the number of connections to the database
to work around a convergence issue.

Change-Id: I01c46197dfebb1eb674817ce81792972a06e529f
(cherry picked from commit 2045a8d880fb83ac8b3e4f948f887fb85ff01fe9)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 23:42:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/proxy.pp', 'manifests/storage/generic.pp', 'manifests/service.pp', 'manifests/storage/container.pp', 'manifests/storage/account.pp', 'manifests/storage/object.pp'], 'message': "Pass subscribe and require into service resource

Before this update, subscribe and require could be passed
into the service class and work due to some default puppet
behaviors. This resulted in unknown variable warnings.  Removal
of these parameters would remove the required resource dependencies.

Adding new parameters 'service_subscribe' and 'service_require'
to pass in these dependencies. The 'service_' prefix is used
here because use of 'subscribe' or 'require' as parameter names
would also print a meta parameter warning.

Change-Id: I33d2d6028347bbe50dc9b3f36b3f86b217db7c0c
"}]
commit_message:
Pass subscribe and require into service resource

Before this update, subscribe and require could be passed
into the service class and work due to some default puppet
behaviors. This resulted in unknown variable warnings.  Removal
of these parameters would remove the required resource dependencies.

Adding new parameters 'service_subscribe' and 'service_require'
to pass in these dependencies. The 'service_' prefix is used
here because use of 'subscribe' or 'require' as parameter names
would also print a meta parameter warning.

Change-Id: I33d2d6028347bbe50dc9b3f36b3f86b217db7c0c

commit_message:
Update configuration.rst documentation

* landing page: increase toc depth for configuration for easier navigation
* landing page: move keystone-manage man page to bottom

* created common keystone-manage commands doc, so config and man page can
  reference

* moved the sample config files section up near config file section
* moved fernet token section up near token section
* moved token flush near token section
* moved endpoint policy and endpoint filter near catalog

* removed references to devstack files that do not exist
* removed references to experimental and stable status for stable features
* removed references to keystoneclient CLI

* removed IANA portions, not config related
* removed section about user CRUD on v2.0 API, not config related

* lots of minor cleanup with syntax and wording

Change-Id: Id814b70d626299ba0717d6759ec6be5e97645a39

commit_message:
Protected property modification with service tokens

This proposes to use the roles from a service token within protected
property access control.

This spec contains a usecase for both Nova and Cinder.

Change-Id: I5c9b7df1661fdbdfb3f57c6234d0440cd1a06e27

commit_message:
db: use eventlet's thread pooling

This wraps the oslo DB API with an option 'use_tpool' to be able to use
eventlet's thread pooling. By default, use_tpool with value False, so
this doesn't change default behavior.

Change-Id: I0fa7d7ca19ddf20610315ac42cc324ca9c35352d

Drop and alter are the two main db migration operations which
usually breaks the schema upgrades. To ensure smooth schema
upgrades its beneficial to block subtractive operations in

Change-Id: I1c9c1f1ab5db011213b1f56b44e8d93b13ece4aa
Implements: blueprint block-subtractive-operations

commit_message:
Block subtractive schema changes

Drop and alter are the two main db migration operations which
usually breaks the schema upgrades. To ensure smooth schema
upgrades its beneficial to block subtractive operations in
schema migration.

Change-Id: I1c9c1f1ab5db011213b1f56b44e8d93b13ece4aa
Implements: blueprint block-subtractive-operations

subject: Glance DB Archiving
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-10 06:44:00.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/glance/db-archiving.rst'], 'message': "Glance DB Archiving

We actually don't delete rows from database, we mark it only as
deleted (we have special column). So the DB is growing and
growing, which causes problem with performance.

Change-Id: I4e20c3c07584d48473dba2fd3df251f68473f507
Implements: blueprint db-archiving
"}]
commit_message:
Glance DB Archiving

We actually don't delete rows from database, we mark it only as
deleted (we have special column). So the DB is growing and
growing, which causes problem with performance.

Change-Id: I4e20c3c07584d48473dba2fd3df251f68473f507
Implements: blueprint db-archiving

commit_message:
Change node to xenial.

The following aodh commit requires mysql>=5.6.4, causing
vitrage jenkins job failures when trusty node is used.
So we specify xenial node.

https://github.com/openstack/aodh/commit/f8d3068bd24db87c50165e37bcf288df33852f77#diff-6f7ec000163298dd067c3235a378b765

Change-Id: Ia74a1eb55f97b13c300cc20c458632c9f9536ecd

subject: removing deprecated options from DEFAULT
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-17 12:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['templates/trove-guestagent.conf.erb'], 'message': 'removing deprecated options from DEFAULT

Default values and options for backup operations, such as
backup_namespace, restore_namespace and backup_runner_options,
are already defined in code.
Specific per database values should be defined in the datastore
sections, their presence in the DEFAULT is deprecated and can
cause confusion and generate errors and conflicts.
We should remove these specific values and leave only the
default common storage strategy and storage options for backups.

Change-Id: Iaf4a316087a1d2bd66c80206fb5b5c344b49ec7e
'}]
commit_message:
removing deprecated options from DEFAULT

Default values and options for backup operations, such as
backup_namespace, restore_namespace and backup_runner_options,
are already defined in code.
Specific per database values should be defined in the datastore
sections, their presence in the DEFAULT is deprecated and can
cause confusion and generate errors and conflicts.
We should remove these specific values and leave only the
default common storage strategy and storage options for backups.

Change-Id: Iaf4a316087a1d2bd66c80206fb5b5c344b49ec7e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-14 17:08:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/objects/service.py'], 'message': 'make Liberty incompatibility error more helpful

If an old Liberty cinder service is still registered, make the error
message which explains this

  a) identify exactly which service is out of date, and
  b) suggest how to fix it.

Stale service records are already documented as a known issue in the
Newton release notes:

  http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/cinder/newton.html#id4

However this change should help avoid confusion for operators like the
type seen here:

  https://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-cloud/2016-10/msg00001.html

Also mention that upgrade should be performed release by release
if live upgrade is required, i.e. to Mitaka first, then Newton etc.

Change-Id: Ic853bfd27de9784375833af16803c5a972de7a6a
'}]
commit_message:
make Liberty incompatibility error more helpful

If an old Liberty cinder service is still registered, make the error
message which explains this

  a) identify exactly which service is out of date, and
  b) suggest how to fix it.

Stale service records are already documented as a known issue in the
Newton release notes:

  http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/cinder/newton.html#id4

However this change should help avoid confusion for operators like the
type seen here:

  https://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-cloud/2016-10/msg00001.html

Also mention that upgrade should be performed release by release
if live upgrade is required, i.e. to Mitaka first, then Newton etc.

Change-Id: Ic853bfd27de9784375833af16803c5a972de7a6a

subject: Support MariaDB error 1927
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 14:22:22.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': 'Support MariaDB error 1927

We're observing a MariaDB-specific error code
"1927 connection was killed", which seems to indicate the condition
where the client/server connectivity is still up but the mariadb
server has been restarted.  This error needs to be supported
as one of the "disconnect" situations so that the ping handler
knows to force a reconnect.

Change-Id: I484237c28a83783689bb8484152476de33f20e3a
References: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1642944
'}]
commit_message:
Support MariaDB error 1927

We're observing a MariaDB-specific error code
"1927 connection was killed", which seems to indicate the condition
where the client/server connectivity is still up but the mariadb
server has been restarted.  This error needs to be supported
as one of the "disconnect" situations so that the ping handler
knows to force a reconnect.

Change-Id: I484237c28a83783689bb8484152476de33f20e3a
References: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1642944

commit_message:
Do not check in-mem dupe in persistent_create_policy

1. Correct an earlier mistake that checked in-mem duplicate in
persistent_create_policy. Existing code causes unintended blocking
of legal policy create when in-mem and DB are out-of-sync.
2. Also took the opportunity to split create_policy into construct
and add-to-runtime to make code clearer.

Change-Id: I506df5e62c76cf48fbc1260b0038d72f405309e5

commit_message:
Suppress ceilometer_driver aodh error

1. fixed copy-and-paste error
statistics_method = lambda: self._translate_events(
    self._get_statistics(self.ceilometer_client.meters.list()))
2. When aodh isn't available, ceilometerclient.alarms.list() errors
  We now suppress the error and record [].
3. ceilometer driver alarms table now deprecated in favor of Aodh
  driver alarms table.

Closes-Bug: 1639128

Change-Id: I33247725faecf6b8198d9ee8f7c25f7c109c34bc

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-17 21:24:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/windows/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/windows/ip_lib.py'], 'message': 'Typo on side_effect rendering the test useless

side_effect does not take a trailing "s", calling
side_effects will simply ignore the call and
continue.  These test work because the no return
value are set, therefore the result is false.

Without changing the tests you can comment out
the try/except without breaking anything.

Fixing the tests shows that the call to
netifaces.ifaddresses was not covered for OSError
and test was missing for ValueError

Change-Id: I770390e99b4b614aff5512da11c0c226dc38b85f
'}]
commit_message:
Typo on side_effect rendering the test useless

side_effect does not take a trailing "s", calling
side_effects will simply ignore the call and
continue.  These test work because the no return
value are set, therefore the result is false.

Without changing the tests you can comment out
the try/except without breaking anything.

Fixing the tests shows that the call to
netifaces.ifaddresses was not covered for OSError
and test was missing for ValueError

Change-Id: I770390e99b4b614aff5512da11c0c226dc38b85f

commit_message:
