Notifier unit tests currently cover image, image.member and
task notification groups. Added equivalent tests to make sure
no notifications are emitted if they are disabled using the
disabled_notifications config option.

commit_message:
Use assertItemsEqual to compare dicts

Refactor _test_get_changed_ips_for_port to use assertItemsEqual
instead of a custom helper function.

assertItemsEqual (known as assertCountEqual in py3) is an
established method for comparing unordered objects.

Change-Id: Ia6ce26877c3d367800f968fa164bbd6a693ffb9d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-22 01:12:38.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_sg_app.py'], 'message': "Make py file line endings unix style

The line endings were CRLF (dos/windows style). The standard is to use
UNIX style endings.
No other change was made to the file.
This is a result of following command in dragonflow folder.

find ./ -name '*.py' -type f -exec dos2unix {} \;

Change-Id: Idba7a231bc84f453309d191240752efee808db0c
"}]
commit_message:
Make py file line endings unix style

The line endings were CRLF (dos/windows style). The standard is to use
UNIX style endings.
No other change was made to the file.
This is a result of following command in dragonflow folder.

find ./ -name '*.py' -type f -exec dos2unix {} \;

Change-Id: Idba7a231bc84f453309d191240752efee808db0c

subject: Insulate TroveContext from oslo.context changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 20:11:24.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/context.py'], 'message': 'Insulate TroveContext from oslo.context changes

Most of the recent issues with compatibility between running guests
and the control plane have been related to changes in oslo.context.
By putting some compatibility code into TroveContext, we should be
able to insulate the environment during upgrades.

Goal here is to reduce the chance of issues when the controller is
upgraded before the guests (which is what every operator wants
to do).

The basic idea here is to introspect the current TroveContext
including the RequestContext base class and remove any unknown
arguments coming off the wire before the constructor is called.

Change-Id: Ia4752c7dfe7bcfedebfaca9f13fb8bc6323d6001
Closes-bug: 1551468
'}]
commit_message:
Insulate TroveContext from oslo.context changes

Most of the recent issues with compatibility between running guests
and the control plane have been related to changes in oslo.context.
By putting some compatibility code into TroveContext, we should be
able to insulate the environment during upgrades.

Goal here is to reduce the chance of issues when the controller is
upgraded before the guests (which is what every operator wants
to do).

The basic idea here is to introspect the current TroveContext
including the RequestContext base class and remove any unknown
arguments coming off the wire before the constructor is called.

Change-Id: Ia4752c7dfe7bcfedebfaca9f13fb8bc6323d6001
Closes-bug: 1551468

commit_message:
Fix unit test

The review[0] has been merged, it deprecated keystone_password in
::glance::registry, but puppet-openstack_extras use the parameter
to do unit test, this will case unit test to fail[1], so fix it.

[0]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395233/
[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/20/398420/1/gate/gate-puppet-openstack_extras-puppet-unit-4.5-centos-7/495ac3b/console.html

Change-Id: Iec55723f478b721197739ecf1bb5dce2f2b8e9f8

subject: remove smooth-scrolling feature
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 16:04:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_themes/releases/static/js/docs.js'], 'message': 'remove smooth-scrolling feature

The javascript in place to make smooth scrolling work when a link points
to an anchor on the same place makes it difficult to send those in-page
references to someone, which is useful for sharing details about the
schedule.

Change-Id: I6e220bbc673227da8e790dcd9d2b19f43e82b98c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove smooth-scrolling feature

The javascript in place to make smooth scrolling work when a link points
to an anchor on the same place makes it difficult to send those in-page
references to someone, which is useful for sharing details about the
schedule.

Change-Id: I6e220bbc673227da8e790dcd9d2b19f43e82b98c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[network-guide] move the network name before --router:external

Because the neutron server response the error: Invalid input for
operation: 'provider' cannot be converted to boolean.

Change-Id: I31bea011f1353b336305bc14b17bcef87b6456bd

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-17 20:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': "Fix reset/start methods on AgentStatusCheckWorker

This worker would fail to start again if stop() or reset()
was called on it because of some bad conditional logic. This
doesn't appear to impact the current in-tree use case but
it should behave correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1641788
Change-Id: Id6334c1ef6c99bd112ada31e8fe3746d7e035356
"}]
commit_message:
Fix reset/start methods on AgentStatusCheckWorker

This worker would fail to start again if stop() or reset()
was called on it because of some bad conditional logic. This
doesn't appear to impact the current in-tree use case but
it should behave correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1641788
Change-Id: Id6334c1ef6c99bd112ada31e8fe3746d7e035356

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-15 10:41:59.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/db-archiving.rst'], 'message': "Cinder DB Archiving

We actually don't delete rows from db, we mark it only as deleted
(we have special column). So the DB is growing and growing,
so this causes problem with performance.

Blueprint db-archiving

Change-Id: I98bd820875d257e440c3db50cc8c432e8e65086c
"}]
commit_message:
Cinder DB Archiving

We actually don't delete rows from db, we mark it only as deleted
(we have special column). So the DB is growing and growing,
so this causes problem with performance.

Blueprint db-archiving

Change-Id: I98bd820875d257e440c3db50cc8c432e8e65086c

subject: Increase timeout in UI test
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-21 17:03:59.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': "Increase timeout in UI test

test_env_status_new_session_remove_from_two fails on the gate in 50%

commit_message:
Increase timeout in UI test

test_env_status_new_session_remove_from_two fails on the gate in 50%
of cases due to timeout error because 'Delete Component' button is not
shown within default 10 seconds. This commit increases the timeout to 30s

Change-Id: I58a4c345a777f7d804cfb1f654fe9cbe175f9e8d

subject: Add timeout parameter in 'reboot' and 'stop'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 10:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['zun/compute/api.py', 'zun/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_manager.py', 'zun/container/docker/driver.py', 'zun/compute/manager.py', 'zun/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_containers.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py'], 'message': "Add timeout parameter in 'reboot' and 'stop'

Currently zun does not support timeout paramater during
container 'stop' and 'reboot'. This patch implements timeout
functionality. If container 'stop' or 'reboot' is performed
with some value then conatiner operation will wait 'timeout'
number of seconds before killing the container.
REST API for this would be '/v1/containers/<uuid>/stop?timeout=10'

Change-Id: I52ebbb289f21b7c94f079858c4f753cf03d7abd5
"}]
commit_message:
Add timeout parameter in 'reboot' and 'stop'

Currently zun does not support timeout paramater during
container 'stop' and 'reboot'. This patch implements timeout
functionality. If container 'stop' or 'reboot' is performed
with some value then conatiner operation will wait 'timeout'
number of seconds before killing the container.
REST API for this would be '/v1/containers/<uuid>/stop?timeout=10'

Change-Id: I52ebbb289f21b7c94f079858c4f753cf03d7abd5

subject: Enable event_dispatchers in devstack installation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 02:59:13.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Enable event_dispatchers in devstack installation

In the devstack plugin script, the event_disapatchers config option is
missing but the event_connection option is enabled, that after stall
devstack installed, no event will be collected and all the message will be
bedetained in "event" message queue. This change enable the
event_dispatchers option.

Change-Id: Ib7c9ca4c3a24fb1756061d1ac9ca0f3bfcd6467c
Closes-Bug: #1643405
'}]
commit_message:
Enable event_dispatchers in devstack installation

In the devstack plugin script, the event_disapatchers config option is
missing but the event_connection option is enabled, that after stall
devstack installed, no event will be collected and all the message will be
bedetained in "event" message queue. This change enable the
event_dispatchers option.

Change-Id: Ib7c9ca4c3a24fb1756061d1ac9ca0f3bfcd6467c
Closes-Bug: #1643405

subject: Fix idempotency error managing provider networks with cliff >= 2.3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 16:13:27.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/neutron_network/neutron.rb'], 'message': "Fix idempotency error managing provider networks with cliff >= 2.3

cliff 2.3 has introduced https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395736/
which replaces ':' by '_' in attribute names when using shell formatter.
Neutron network has several attributes with ':' in their names.

This patches modifies neutron_network to work fine with both
former and new behavior of cliff library.

Change-Id: Ic997cef9a27f89add97e4ae558383ac2fa1f7416
Closes-Bug: #1643044
"}]
commit_message:
Fix idempotency error managing provider networks with cliff >= 2.3

cliff 2.3 has introduced https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395736/
which replaces ':' by '_' in attribute names when using shell formatter.
Neutron network has several attributes with ':' in their names.

This patches modifies neutron_network to work fine with both
former and new behavior of cliff library.

Change-Id: Ic997cef9a27f89add97e4ae558383ac2fa1f7416
Closes-Bug: #1643044

subject: Refactor current queues actions
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-17 01:31:37.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/transport/wsgi/v2_0/__init__.py', 'zaqar/transport/wsgi/v2_0/stats.py', 'zaqar/transport/wsgi/v2_0/urls.py', 'zaqar/transport/wsgi/v2_0/queues_actions.py'], 'message': "Refactor current queues actions

Currently Zaqar support 'stats' and 'share' as the queue actions,
they are designed in different files as separate resources. It's not
good. And the suggestion from api-wg is it would be nice to take
'actions' as a resource. Unfortunately, we have 'stats' and 'share'
already which are not designed as a unified resource. So in this
patch, it's going to get a mid-point. After this, we can get rid
of the stats.py and urls.py files.

Partially implements: blueprint purge-queue

Change-Id: I09226b7fabc020a9b80e84a34e6836f569acdaa1
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor current queues actions

Currently Zaqar support 'stats' and 'share' as the queue actions,
they are designed in different files as separate resources. It's not
good. And the suggestion from api-wg is it would be nice to take
'actions' as a resource. Unfortunately, we have 'stats' and 'share'
already which are not designed as a unified resource. So in this
patch, it's going to get a mid-point. After this, we can get rid
of the stats.py and urls.py files.

Partially implements: blueprint purge-queue

Change-Id: I09226b7fabc020a9b80e84a34e6836f569acdaa1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-14 23:16:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Add a check before deleting compute serivce

Now at the db layer, Nova is using same method for deleting
compute service and the other serivces. Unfortunately, there
is no service type check when deleting a compute service. As
a result, the compute will be deleted accidently if the
targeting servivce running on the compute node. This patch
fixes this by adding a service type check.

Closes-Bug: #1587702

Change-Id: Iaddaa0fb4ea2f1a91856f088f67d7b02c50f1a65
'}]
commit_message:
Add a check before deleting compute serivce

Now at the db layer, Nova is using same method for deleting
compute service and the other serivces. Unfortunately, there
is no service type check when deleting a compute service. As
a result, the compute will be deleted accidently if the
targeting servivce running on the compute node. This patch
fixes this by adding a service type check.

Closes-Bug: #1587702

Change-Id: Iaddaa0fb4ea2f1a91856f088f67d7b02c50f1a65

subject: Disable puppetlabs-mongodb dbpath_fix
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 21:53:01.000000000', 'files': ['hiera/common.yaml'], 'message': "Disable puppetlabs-mongodb dbpath_fix

The dbpath_fix in the mongodb module will correct permissions on the
data files. Unfortunately the data files are being created with the
nogroup group so it leads to some idempotency issues when the files get
created.  This is currently blocking the promotion of the module. Since
we don't require this functionality for p-o-i, let's turn it off.

Change-Id: Ia864387f2f4b4bcc02d71c046394d03dae20a411
"}]
commit_message:
Disable puppetlabs-mongodb dbpath_fix

The dbpath_fix in the mongodb module will correct permissions on the
data files. Unfortunately the data files are being created with the
nogroup group so it leads to some idempotency issues when the files get
created.  This is currently blocking the promotion of the module. Since
we don't require this functionality for p-o-i, let's turn it off.

Change-Id: Ia864387f2f4b4bcc02d71c046394d03dae20a411

When IronicException is raised, do not replace it with a more generic one.

commit_message:
Fix exception handling in iscsi_deploy.continue_deploy

When IronicException is raised, do not replace it with a more generic one.
When unexpected Exception is raised, log it as LOG.exception, not LOG.error.
Otherwise it may be impossible to figure out what went wrong, e.g.
in case of a stdlib exception.

Change-Id: I60ec259f56948e473c9b5c363372215edfe21dea
Related-Bug: #1626544

commit_message:
Refactor nb db models

The nb db models have common attributes and methods,  however, the common
attributes and methods are implemented separately. This fact makes code
for nb db models redundant and hard to maintain.

This patch moves all nb db models to a new module dragonflow.db.db_models,
and uses common super class to maintain the common attributes and methods.

Change-Id: Ifda9af500df80141e3828ff13614d417814485ba
Partial-Bug: #1633082

subject: Adds auto-detection for VIP interfaces
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-20 16:48:05.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/keepalived.pp', 'manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Adds auto-detection for VIP interfaces

Previously the ctrl plane VIP would default to 'br-ex' which in non-vlan
deployments ends up being the wrong interface.  The public VIP interface
was also defaulted to 'br-ex' which would be incorrect for vlan based
deployments.  Since a user has already given the nic template (and in
most cases the subnet that corresponds to the nic) the installer should
be able to figure out which interface the public/control vip should be
on.

These changes enable that type of auto-detection, unless a user
explicitly overrides the heat parameters for ControlVirtualInterface and
PublicVirtualInterface.  Also removes calling keepalived from haproxy
now that the services are composed separately on the Controller role.

Partial-Bug: 1606632

Change-Id: I05105fce85be8ace986db351cdca2916f405ed04
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Adds auto-detection for VIP interfaces

Previously the ctrl plane VIP would default to 'br-ex' which in non-vlan
deployments ends up being the wrong interface.  The public VIP interface
was also defaulted to 'br-ex' which would be incorrect for vlan based
deployments.  Since a user has already given the nic template (and in
most cases the subnet that corresponds to the nic) the installer should
be able to figure out which interface the public/control vip should be
on.

These changes enable that type of auto-detection, unless a user
explicitly overrides the heat parameters for ControlVirtualInterface and
PublicVirtualInterface.  Also removes calling keepalived from haproxy
now that the services are composed separately on the Controller role.

Partial-Bug: 1606632

Change-Id: I05105fce85be8ace986db351cdca2916f405ed04
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.0.3

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

commit_message:
Disable API v1 by default

The v1 API has been deprecated by default since Juno. While we've
determined we can't get rid of it in the foreseeable future, we
shouldn't enable it by default. This may encourage any remaining
users to migrate.

This will also get rid of some warning messages in the logs on
startup warning of the deprecated API.

Change-Id: Ieea9a6c764eb1b55ad399a96e218d773ad4c59a5
Partial-bug: #1413102
(cherry picked from commit 7fcca079ff63f1a1b6d4d3067508883f01515add)

subject: Remove extra resource definition loading
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 16:35:21.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Remove extra resource definition loading

With the current resource list implementation, we end up recreating
resource definitions for every single resource, as we cache the
template, but not the definitions. Caching that instead improves
resource listing by a good chunk.

Change-Id: Ic3b252cd9c2d61abbe2b247375e5e917562a4952
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extra resource definition loading

With the current resource list implementation, we end up recreating
resource definitions for every single resource, as we cache the
template, but not the definitions. Caching that instead improves
resource listing by a good chunk.

Change-Id: Ic3b252cd9c2d61abbe2b247375e5e917562a4952

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-18 04:54:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/horizon'], 'message': "Always set ALLOWED_HOSTS for horizon

If devstack is deployed in the VM with defined
public IP address (like 192.168.10.6) it is not possible to
access the Horizon from the browser.
This is because DEBUG=True means that ALLOWED_HOSTS, if not set,
is equal to ['localhost', '127.0.0.1', '[::1]'] according
to Django's documentation.

Change-Id: I74ae99569dafa10eee7066713a05fb49183e3fca
"}]
commit_message:
Always set ALLOWED_HOSTS for horizon

If devstack is deployed in the VM with defined
public IP address (like 192.168.10.6) it is not possible to
access the Horizon from the browser.
This is because DEBUG=True means that ALLOWED_HOSTS, if not set,
is equal to ['localhost', '127.0.0.1', '[::1]'] according
to Django's documentation.

Change-Id: I74ae99569dafa10eee7066713a05fb49183e3fca

Change-Id: If78b948e6162c22bd71cb4967d2c369e54a8a318

commit_message:
DNM: what happens if we don't use the fixed ip on attach?

I'm pretty sure we never use the fixed IP provided with
a newtork on allocate_for_instance, either at server
create or when attaching an interface. And Tempest probably
doesn't test this anywhere.

Change-Id: If78b948e6162c22bd71cb4967d2c369e54a8a318

commit_message:
Run ovs appctl execution of flows more times

To deal with the issue that performance of different machines may
affect the result of _check_flow_existance, we make the ovs appctl
execution of flows to run more times with sleep time intervals.
Change-Id: I1465d99769cebc4182fa3b02d7aad852da10f8ce

commit_message:
Update the alembic migration section in the developer FAQ

After we've introduced a migration that relies on CONF option
in commit 1514b2a2f6, following the instruction steps will lead
to an ImportError. Change direct usage of the alembic command to
calling ironic-dbsync from the virtualenv.

Change-Id: I28e51e45c4e5cdb223795dbb4d720d233cd57808

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-08 14:48:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py'], 'message': 'Increase driver dict generation robustness

This patch introduces a try-catch block on a call to the os-brick library
which may throw a ValueError. os-brick will throw it when a driver is not
supported, so ignoring it and skipping its addition to the driver list
should be the expected behavior.

This fix is required for s390, where nova is currently broken without it.

Change-Id: Ibd062911206f67181b3b74b7d7a4ffbfa9d699be
Closes-Bug: 1639239
'}]
commit_message:
Increase driver dict generation robustness

This patch introduces a try-catch block on a call to the os-brick library
which may throw a ValueError. os-brick will throw it when a driver is not
supported, so ignoring it and skipping its addition to the driver list
should be the expected behavior.

This fix is required for s390, where nova is currently broken without it.

Change-Id: Ibd062911206f67181b3b74b7d7a4ffbfa9d699be
Closes-Bug: 1639239

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.9

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I0683a4a237af97738d6216f7eb8f23982ff120c6
Change-Id: If54b022dedca5e4458562a1af0c8d1486c174dfd

subject: pin puppetlabs-mongodb to 0.14.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 21:11:46.000000000', 'files': ['external_modules.txt'], 'message': "pin puppetlabs-mongodb to 0.14.0

0.16.0 is not idempotent on Ubuntu Xenial, this is likely a regression
in 0.15.0 and not fixed yet. Once we'll fix it, we'll probably go back
to latest tag, that will be 0.17.0. But until then, we need to keep
updating other modules.

Change-Id: I3c49a3df7053dee7a99e1c18920c0e74b1022e40
"}]
commit_message:
pin puppetlabs-mongodb to 0.14.0

0.16.0 is not idempotent on Ubuntu Xenial, this is likely a regression
in 0.15.0 and not fixed yet. Once we'll fix it, we'll probably go back
to latest tag, that will be 0.17.0. But until then, we need to keep
updating other modules.

Change-Id: I3c49a3df7053dee7a99e1c18920c0e74b1022e40

commit_message:
make a non-voting gate-trove-functional-mysql-ubuntu-xenial job

The goal of this commit is to create a single non-voting
gate-trove-functional-mysql-ubuntu-xenial job that will only run in
the master branch of the trove project. It will be used to verify a
change that will make it possible to run the trove CI jobs for master
on xenial nodes.

Change-Id: Ibc0ac0ae205a748ffaa7fb4c8e4305d75515aae1

subject: ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 20:36:10.000000000', 'files': ['networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/agent_base.py', 'networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/sea_agent.py', 'networking_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/base.py', 'networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/sriov_agent.py', 'networking_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/test_sea_agent.py', 'networking_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/test_prov_req.py', 'networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/prov_req.py'], 'message': 'ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source

VIFEventHandler creates ProvisionRequest and passed down to agents for
processing. Currently, there is nothing in ProvisionRequest to
distinguish it between CNA or VNIC related. Due to this, SEA agent
gets VNIC related ProvisionRequests and processes to provision vlan
on SEA. This needs to be avoided. This patchset introduces vif_type
attribute into ProvisionRequest.

Refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396739/ for a change in
nova_powervm. vif_type is now part of the event generated when a vif
is plugged or unplugged. This patchset uses the newly introduced
vif_type in the event while generating ProvisionRequest.

A new abstract property has been added to base_agent to carry
corresponding vif_type. Both sea_agent and sriov_agent have been
updated to return appropriate vif_type property. If vif_type in
incoming event does not match with vif_type supported by agent,
ProvisionRequest is not generated. And so, agent is not notified to
provision device.

For example, in the case of SR-IOV based plug, event carries
vif_type as pvm_sriov, and SEA agent supports vif_type as pvm_sea.
No ProvisionRequest is generated and sea_agent provison device
function is not invoked, so no vlan is provisioned.

Change-Id: Ifccaf4ee9ce492a295958393baf48bb383319805
Closes-Bug: #1640564
(cherry picked from commit a5f5fccdc0826e00e9f9910157a9817a4a47b4b0)
'}]
commit_message:
ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source

VIFEventHandler creates ProvisionRequest and passed down to agents for
processing. Currently, there is nothing in ProvisionRequest to
distinguish it between CNA or VNIC related. Due to this, SEA agent
gets VNIC related ProvisionRequests and processes to provision vlan
on SEA. This needs to be avoided. This patchset introduces vif_type
attribute into ProvisionRequest.

Refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396739/ for a change in
nova_powervm. vif_type is now part of the event generated when a vif
is plugged or unplugged. This patchset uses the newly introduced
vif_type in the event while generating ProvisionRequest.

A new abstract property has been added to base_agent to carry
corresponding vif_type. Both sea_agent and sriov_agent have been
updated to return appropriate vif_type property. If vif_type in
incoming event does not match with vif_type supported by agent,
ProvisionRequest is not generated. And so, agent is not notified to
provision device.

For example, in the case of SR-IOV based plug, event carries
vif_type as pvm_sriov, and SEA agent supports vif_type as pvm_sea.
No ProvisionRequest is generated and sea_agent provison device
function is not invoked, so no vlan is provisioned.

Change-Id: Ifccaf4ee9ce492a295958393baf48bb383319805
Closes-Bug: #1640564
(cherry picked from commit a5f5fccdc0826e00e9f9910157a9817a4a47b4b0)

Deployments with a Ceph Storage component fail without this parameter.
Currently it's generated automatically when deploying with the CLI,
this re-uses the same code.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-16 10:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Refactor console checks in live migration process

_check_graphics_addresses_can_live_migrate was added to check
whether we can live migrate a VM with VNC/SPICE enabled when:

* libvirt did not allow to change and migrate guest XML with
  updated graphics listen addresses. Right now we always can update
  VNC/SPICE listen address.
* Destination node was running old-code that does not set the fields.
  Currently when live migrating between two versions of OpenStack
  (N and N-1) the fields are always set.

Therefore this check is redundant and can be removed.

Going deeper in this code - graphics_listen_addr_vnc and
graphics_listen_addr_spice in libvirt migrate data object are of
type IPAddressField. It means that both need to contain valid IP address.
By default in nova.conf it is 127.0.0.1. It can't be set to None because
IP address is taken from nova.conf and even if set to None it will be
passed as a string 'None' and will fail IPAddressField validation.

graphics_listen_addrs in migration.py currently always returns a dict
which contains IP addresses of both VNC and spice graphics consoles.

This means that:
* check 'if listen_addrs' is always True
* check 'if not listen_addrs' is always False

So we really never passed through 'if not listen_addrs' since
migrate_data is objectified as those addresses are always there.

However, serial_listen_addr is handled different way. The type of
this field in libvirt migrate data object is StringField that might
be set to None or empty string through nova.conf. So we still need
to validate whether serial console can be migrated so that we will
be sure that particular live migration will not break serial console
in case when serial listen address is not configured at destination.

Change-Id: I73f7bfafa4554bf1c2dfc980289be88154170282
Closes-Bug: #1639312
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor console checks in live migration process

_check_graphics_addresses_can_live_migrate was added to check
whether we can live migrate a VM with VNC/SPICE enabled when:

* libvirt did not allow to change and migrate guest XML with
  updated graphics listen addresses. Right now we always can update
  VNC/SPICE listen address.
* Destination node was running old-code that does not set the fields.
  Currently when live migrating between two versions of OpenStack
  (N and N-1) the fields are always set.

Therefore this check is redundant and can be removed.

Going deeper in this code - graphics_listen_addr_vnc and
graphics_listen_addr_spice in libvirt migrate data object are of
type IPAddressField. It means that both need to contain valid IP address.
By default in nova.conf it is 127.0.0.1. It can't be set to None because
IP address is taken from nova.conf and even if set to None it will be
passed as a string 'None' and will fail IPAddressField validation.

graphics_listen_addrs in migration.py currently always returns a dict
which contains IP addresses of both VNC and spice graphics consoles.

This means that:
* check 'if listen_addrs' is always True
* check 'if not listen_addrs' is always False

So we really never passed through 'if not listen_addrs' since
migrate_data is objectified as those addresses are always there.

However, serial_listen_addr is handled different way. The type of
this field in libvirt migrate data object is StringField that might
be set to None or empty string through nova.conf. So we still need
to validate whether serial console can be migrated so that we will
be sure that particular live migration will not break serial console
in case when serial listen address is not configured at destination.

Change-Id: I73f7bfafa4554bf1c2dfc980289be88154170282
Closes-Bug: #1639312

commit_message:
ovsfw: small cleanups to improve readability

security_group_updated is actually called but of no use for ovsfw.
Fix the comment to reflect the reality.  In iptables_firewall, the
method is used to clear obsolete conntrack entries, but ovsfw implements
that differently.  Also, remove empty definition of apply_port_filter,
which is never called.

Change-Id: I26b402e0fa5ac19022e022bf7c51e171d0f5d333
Closes-Bug: #1606462

subject: ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 20:08:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vif.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vif.py'], 'message': 'ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source

This patchset is to support review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396467/ of networking_powervm
patchset. ProvisionRequest in networking_powervm is built on
event generated by nova_powervm when a vif is plugged or unplugged.
It needs a way to identify source of such an event. This patchset
provides it. When a plug or unplug event is generated, corresponding
vif_type is also passed into it under details attribute.

This patchset is a cherry-pick from master.
This second patchset removes references to instance variable
introduced using this patchset in master:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385144/

Change-Id: I6266ad485b10bdfa21a7b4e66600dfbd6ab1f2fc
Closes-Bug: #1640564
'}]
commit_message:
ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source

This patchset is to support review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396467/ of networking_powervm
patchset. ProvisionRequest in networking_powervm is built on
event generated by nova_powervm when a vif is plugged or unplugged.
It needs a way to identify source of such an event. This patchset
provides it. When a plug or unplug event is generated, corresponding
vif_type is also passed into it under details attribute.

This patchset is a cherry-pick from master.
This second patchset removes references to instance variable
introduced using this patchset in master:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385144/

Change-Id: I6266ad485b10bdfa21a7b4e66600dfbd6ab1f2fc
Closes-Bug: #1640564

commit_message:
Use uuidutils instead of uuid.uuid4()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating
uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Iadd98fd145e7f0a37c953936feaf69bd3527000f
Closes-Bug: #1082248

subject: ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 9572, 'name': 'Eric Larese', 'email': 'erlarese@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'erlarese'}, {'_account_id': 10547, 'name': 'Esha Seth', 'email': 'eshaseth@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'EshaSeth'}, {'_account_id': 12947, 'name': 'Sridhar Venkat', 'email': 'svenkat@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'svenkat'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-18 13:31:51.000000000', 'files': ['networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/agent_base.py', 'networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/sea_agent.py', 'networking_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/base.py', 'networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/sriov_agent.py', 'networking_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/test_sea_agent.py', 'networking_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/test_prov_req.py', 'networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/prov_req.py'], 'message': 'ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source

VIFEventHandler creates ProvisionRequest and passed down to agents for
processing. Currently, there is nothing in ProvisionRequest to
distinguish it between CNA or VNIC related. Due to this, SEA agent
gets VNIC related ProvisionRequests and processes to provision vlan
on SEA. This needs to be avoided. This patchset introduces vif_type
attribute into ProvisionRequest.

Refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396739/ for a change in
nova_powervm. vif_type is now part of the event generated when a vif
is plugged or unplugged. This patchset uses the newly introduced
vif_type in the event while generating ProvisionRequest.

A new abstract property has been added to base_agent to carry
corresponding vif_type. Both sea_agent and sriov_agent have been
updated to return appropriate vif_type property. If vif_type in
incoming event does not match with vif_type supported by agent,
ProvisionRequest is not generated. And so, agent is not notified to
provision device.

For example, in the case of SR-IOV based plug, event carries
vif_type as pvm_sriov, and SEA agent supports vif_type as pvm_sea.
No ProvisionRequest is generated and sea_agent provison device
function is not invoked, so no vlan is provisioned.

Change-Id: Ifccaf4ee9ce492a295958393baf48bb383319805
Closes-Bug: #1640564
'}]
commit_message:
ProvisionRequest does not distinguish event source

VIFEventHandler creates ProvisionRequest and passed down to agents for
processing. Currently, there is nothing in ProvisionRequest to
distinguish it between CNA or VNIC related. Due to this, SEA agent
gets VNIC related ProvisionRequests and processes to provision vlan
on SEA. This needs to be avoided. This patchset introduces vif_type
attribute into ProvisionRequest.

Refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396739/ for a change in
nova_powervm. vif_type is now part of the event generated when a vif
is plugged or unplugged. This patchset uses the newly introduced
vif_type in the event while generating ProvisionRequest.

A new abstract property has been added to base_agent to carry
corresponding vif_type. Both sea_agent and sriov_agent have been
updated to return appropriate vif_type property. If vif_type in
incoming event does not match with vif_type supported by agent,
ProvisionRequest is not generated. And so, agent is not notified to
provision device.

For example, in the case of SR-IOV based plug, event carries
vif_type as pvm_sriov, and SEA agent supports vif_type as pvm_sea.
No ProvisionRequest is generated and sea_agent provison device
function is not invoked, so no vlan is provisioned.

Change-Id: Ifccaf4ee9ce492a295958393baf48bb383319805
Closes-Bug: #1640564

commit_message:
prevent non-admin user search soft-delete server

soft-delete server like deleted server except they
will keep in system for a while depends on configuration,
we should not allow non-admin user query them.

also, previously
/v2.1/servers/detail?status=soft_deleted
won't work correctly even if it's an admin query because
a soft_deleted=True is expected in search opts otherwise
the instance will still be filtered out.

Change-Id: I0df0893495cefe11aa64a3a627f928d07d35d448
Closes-Bug: 1526715
Closes-Bug: 1620684

subject: Better handling of KVM nested state changes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 16:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['roles/parts/kvm/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/parts/kvm/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Better handling of KVM nested state changes

* add possiblity to disable nested virtualization
* remove all previous nested virtualization settings from modprobe.d
* only reload kvm module if the nested state is not matching the desired
* remove unused default options for the kernel modules

The previous solution could add extra module configurations if old ones
were present and required reloading the KVM module. Reload fails on
virthosts with active VMs. Also checked that nested=1 works on the intel
module on a recent (3.10) kernel (most online docs use nested=Y).

Change-Id: I491ff20240c7a87afea07b4dd6f83bad005de3be
'}]
commit_message:
Better handling of KVM nested state changes

* add possiblity to disable nested virtualization
* remove all previous nested virtualization settings from modprobe.d
* only reload kvm module if the nested state is not matching the desired
* remove unused default options for the kernel modules

The previous solution could add extra module configurations if old ones
were present and required reloading the KVM module. Reload fails on
virthosts with active VMs. Also checked that nested=1 works on the intel
module on a recent (3.10) kernel (most online docs use nested=Y).

Change-Id: I491ff20240c7a87afea07b4dd6f83bad005de3be

If providers is not found in the CONF.service_providers.service_provider
it looks them up from implicit conf files. If nothing is defined there
it still emits a deprecation warning.

Maybe a warning should be emitted if this value is empty, however the

Closes-Bug: #1633293

commit_message:
Only emit deprecation warning when deprecated value read

If providers is not found in the CONF.service_providers.service_provider
it looks them up from implicit conf files. If nothing is defined there
it still emits a deprecation warning.

Maybe a warning should be emitted if this value is empty, however the
deprecation warning that is provided is incorrect and misleading.

Change-Id: I3166a445b69d854b294843814a081e74c1aadb3b
Closes-Bug: #1633293

commit_message:
Stop disabling the Neutron tempest plugin

The root cause for the Inspector grenade failures was an eventlet
monkey patch[1]. The issue now being solved, disabling the Neutron
tempest plugin is no longer necessary.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399469/

Closes-bug: #1621791
Change-Id: Icaca019880054e1d89b81736c2815a222e8abc45

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-17 18:42:19.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/post_deployment/upgrade.rst', 'doc/source/repositories.txt', 'doc/source/basic_deployment/basic_deployment_cli.rst'], 'message': "Uses Ceph/Hammer repos for Liberty and Mitaka only

The use of Ceph/Hammer is not for all stable branches but only for
the Liberty and Mitaka stable releases; Newton will use Ceph/Jewel
instead. This change moves the Ceph repo admonitions within the
relevant stable branch.

Also suggests upgrade of 'cephstorage' nodes before 'compute' nodes
so that Ceph cluster is upgraded to the newest release before the
OpenStack upgrade is started.

Change-Id: Ia12e4f7d6fa7b8ecff7dcec6b5cd85804a049070
"}]
commit_message:
Uses Ceph/Hammer repos for Liberty and Mitaka only

The use of Ceph/Hammer is not for all stable branches but only for
the Liberty and Mitaka stable releases; Newton will use Ceph/Jewel
instead. This change moves the Ceph repo admonitions within the
relevant stable branch.

Also suggests upgrade of 'cephstorage' nodes before 'compute' nodes
so that Ceph cluster is upgraded to the newest release before the
OpenStack upgrade is started.

Change-Id: Ia12e4f7d6fa7b8ecff7dcec6b5cd85804a049070

subject: Replace assertEquals with assertEqual
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 08:59:58.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

This is part of blueprint assertequal

Change-Id: Ie6b881f594c0b3e7015e70a12d7ac720fa765736
'}]
commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

This is part of blueprint assertequal

Change-Id: Ie6b881f594c0b3e7015e70a12d7ac720fa765736

revisions:

This patch adds the option deploy.power_off_after_cleaning, default
true, which can be set to false to prevent ironic powering nodes off
after cleaning is completed. This can be useful for deployers who
want quicker deployments, as ironic will use the pre-booted agent
for deployment rather than having to wait a full POST cycle before
starting deployment.

Change-Id: I31029da6c768e29da0367efd4e2d3042d0f8b8d6
Related-bug: 1531217
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Make powering off nodes after cleaning optional

This patch adds the option deploy.power_off_after_cleaning, default
true, which can be set to false to prevent ironic powering nodes off
after cleaning is completed. This can be useful for deployers who
want quicker deployments, as ironic will use the pre-booted agent
for deployment rather than having to wait a full POST cycle before
starting deployment.

Change-Id: I31029da6c768e29da0367efd4e2d3042d0f8b8d6
Related-bug: 1531217
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>

subject: Fix the required package variable name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 14:49:38.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/var-rename-required-pip-packages-632851ef8137a4a1.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_install.yml'], 'message': "Fix the required package variable name

The variable 'gnocchi_required_pip_packages' is incorrectly named,
resulting in the potential for the packages in the list not being
built in the repo build and causing other issues with anything
that uses that pattern to find the package list.

This patch corrects the variable name to match the pattern across
all other roles.

Change-Id: Ie636dfeb4497c8d3703977bd55d53d1efba7d539
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the required package variable name

The variable 'gnocchi_required_pip_packages' is incorrectly named,
resulting in the potential for the packages in the list not being
built in the repo build and causing other issues with anything
that uses that pattern to find the package list.

This patch corrects the variable name to match the pattern across
all other roles.

Change-Id: Ie636dfeb4497c8d3703977bd55d53d1efba7d539

commit_message:
Fix test_unwatch_log() to cleanup after itself

Use get_temp_file_patch() so a unique directory is used
for test files, and so that anything created will get
cleaned-up on completion.

commit_message:
Remove timeutils.clear_time_override in neutron

The clear_time_override function in timeutils was written as a
helper function to mock utcnow for unittests before 'mock' was
generally used. Now that we have mock and fixture, we no longer
need to use it.

Change-Id: I7baa623fd71a7d03acc61dd1f18287bb654539cd
Partial-Bug: #1266962

commit_message:
Replace uuid4() with generate_uuid() from oslo_utils

UUID can be generated using uuid4() as well as
uuidutils.generate_utils(). Since we are using the latter in the
Mistral code, we shall maintain the same on the client as well.

Change-Id: I65c27bb6253cecc80bd538ba6d59022141d22b6c
Closes-Bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Default $STABLE_RELEASE in bootstrap-overcloud-full.sh

This script is meant to be able to be used standalone as well as from
tripleo-ci. The $STABLE_RELEASE variable needs to be defaulted to an
empty string otherwise the script will fail since it is set -u.

Change-Id: I6aa8bd3b01b1147de9b45f40ded8318fb46dcaf8

commit_message:
(fix gate) Set up networking for Neutron

Now that devstack uses Neutron by default (and so does the gate)
we need to open the private network to access it through the
alt_demo tenant for the int-tests to work.
(see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/355492 )

The tcp_ports configuration was also moved to facilitate both
network styles.

The 'PUBLIC_INTERFACE=eth0' line was also moved to be in just
nova networking as it is not necessary for Neutron (and caused
the network to become unstable).  This should allow it to
continue working for backwards compatibility if required.

A number of changes to code and/or tests were also required.
Since these are specifically tied to the switch to neutron
(as they are equally valid for nova-net) they have been
made separately and referenced below in the 'Depends-On' list.
This should also facilitate easier reviews and make it
possible to backport any of the fixes if required.

Change-Id: I3359b679c870ea48cb1a8f55d316204079e246fe
Depends-On: I8f3d0d2a77999fc15ba10044930b37c030ad63dd
Depends-On: I136141b3db78b7a0a1804bb5e3d4ca5cf4bc3bb3
Depends-On: I82d6fafc32068c646da0416d91d5f00352091ee2
Depends-On: I47cbe9e899cb0767c377d184f123e38eda5b6a05
Depends-On: I2ede074eb9bdf26420750f19f3aa4b8d057c5d7d
Depends-On: I6aff776680c9c0632d8965c3ed70ed26db0a63f2
Depends-On: I54edc4acac09ca2278f525c08ad0d87576f0549e
Depends-On: Iab530fe503336c83e9b948c2c008d371a8030a1e
Closes-Bug: #1613889

subject: Use assert_called_*/assert_not_called to verify mock calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 10:11:11.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/tests/v1/test_certificates_shell.py', 'magnumclient/tests/v1/test_mservices_shell.py'], 'message': 'Use assert_called_*/assert_not_called to verify mock calls

Currently assertTrue and assertFalse are used to check
wheter a mock method is called. It is not checked whether
mock method is called with correct set of arguments.
With this patch following modules uses assert_called_* and
assert_not_called instead of assertTrue and assertFalse.

- magnumclient/tests/v1/test_certificates_shell.py
- magnumclient/tests/v1/test_mservices_shell.py

Also, renamed "file_mock" to "mock_file" for consistent
mock naming in the modules.

Change-Id: I706b362509f6a59be13df8d9c132e4f4b68e0060
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnumclient-ut-coverage
'}]
commit_message:
Use assert_called_*/assert_not_called to verify mock calls

Currently assertTrue and assertFalse are used to check
wheter a mock method is called. It is not checked whether
mock method is called with correct set of arguments.
With this patch following modules uses assert_called_* and
assert_not_called instead of assertTrue and assertFalse.

- magnumclient/tests/v1/test_certificates_shell.py
- magnumclient/tests/v1/test_mservices_shell.py

Also, renamed "file_mock" to "mock_file" for consistent
mock naming in the modules.

Change-Id: I706b362509f6a59be13df8d9c132e4f4b68e0060
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnumclient-ut-coverage

commit_message:
Increase unit test coverage for muranodashboard Packages Tables
and Packages API.

In addition, renamed and moved the following test files for
better organization in the unit test directory:
- test_tables -> environments/test_tables
- test_packages -> packages/test_api

Lastly, updated packages/test_views to fix single failing
test in py27-mitaka-ubuntu-xenial.

Implements bp: murano-unit-test-coverage

subject: Replace 'assertEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNone(...)'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 06:10:24.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/unit/packages/test_views.py'], 'message': "Replace 'assertEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNone(...)'

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: I3f103981e397af7a556468fbf485f6e062c328d1
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'assertEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNone(...)'

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: I3f103981e397af7a556468fbf485f6e062c328d1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 13:45:54.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/fuel_bootstrap/files/trusty/etc/rc.local'], 'message': "Don't use rc.local to start fix-configs-on-startup

It looks like mcollective is restarted two times duting boot
process. First, it simply restarted by nailgun-agent to change
node's ID. And then it gets restarted by fix-configs-on-startup
after it fixes mcollective's configuration file.

It turns out that such sequence of restarts may cause node's
provisioning problems when node's boot process is delayed. The
simpe workaround is to run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
and exclude fix-configs-on-startup from rc.local.

Change-Id: I28b8d632faa753b693eb2277c5989092f29afa21
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use rc.local to start fix-configs-on-startup

It looks like mcollective is restarted two times duting boot
process. First, it simply restarted by nailgun-agent to change
node's ID. And then it gets restarted by fix-configs-on-startup
after it fixes mcollective's configuration file.

It turns out that such sequence of restarts may cause node's
provisioning problems when node's boot process is delayed. The
simpe workaround is to run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
and exclude fix-configs-on-startup from rc.local.

Change-Id: I28b8d632faa753b693eb2277c5989092f29afa21

commit_message:
Fix mongo logs verbosity

W/o this patch a mongo logs are too huge to be processed by
logrotate without issues.

The solution is to reduce the non debug verbosity level for logs
and do not log all transactions as well (use the quiet option):
* Sync the quiet parameter from puppetlabs-mongodb v0.10.0
* Lower the logs verbosity for a non debug case
* Use the quiet parameter for a non debug case

Closes-bug: #1427197
Related-bug: #1393400

Change-Id: I3a3ba70029167928565baa46a77a5c0c0dbacbe8
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3f99d39be882cd6a05d4f07f95c3cc8ffb3f4f00)

commit_message:
Use endpoint as endpoint_override

Number of projects like rally pass endpoint rather than
endpoint_override when using session with heatclient.

Use endpoint as endpoint_override when not specified.

Make it backward compatible.

Change-Id: Iff977424a15ac2ce3ffdf8d7c98d5e72d25c1e91
Closes-Bug: #1643507

commit_message:
Allow bifrost to work with selinux enabled

Currently when selinux is enabled, nginx fails with permission
denied on /httpboot, and could not bind to address errors.
To fix port issues: add the right rule to selinux
To fix permission issues: add the right policies and custom
modules to selinux

Change-Id: Ieb5afe758981940a04c5076d2cebd6746db57da1

commit_message:
Use messagingv2 by default

Messaging driver should only be used in cases where there are existing
consumers deployed which do not support the 2.0 message format [1]. We
need to change to use messagingv2 instead of messaging driver in
devstack and documentation.

[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/notifier.html?highlight=messagingv2#messaging

Change-Id: Iaed12f4b62bc7efe0ab37489b86acdfdd9449267
Closes-bug: #1643433

commit_message:
Revert "[PY3] byte/string conversions and enable PY3 test"

This reverts commit 0f152eb66153e16d4d8aba0f8afebaab046aea35.

the change to nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py breaks if nova is deployed over
mod_wsgi. In python 2.X it expects headers to be byte strings while this
converted them to unicode. However, in python 3.X it does expect
unicode.

This commit is being reverted since it breaks TripleO (since it deploys
nova over httpd.

Change-Id: Ie6f8afdb7fd22ff85bc17f3163d3e1bcb544a96c
Closes-Bug: #1643511

subject: add ipa-api-url in pxe default config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-17 07:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install.rst'], 'message': 'add ipa-api-url in pxe default config

We need to add ipa-api-url in $TFTPROOT/pxelinux.cfg/default, or
it will use http://127.0.0.1:6385/ as the default ironic api url
on ramdisk while inspecting the node, add report ConnectionError.

Change-Id: I13cdf107a06c2aff11d468f51278e3bec343d78b
'}]
commit_message:
add ipa-api-url in pxe default config

We need to add ipa-api-url in $TFTPROOT/pxelinux.cfg/default, or
it will use http://127.0.0.1:6385/ as the default ironic api url
on ramdisk while inspecting the node, add report ConnectionError.

Change-Id: I13cdf107a06c2aff11d468f51278e3bec343d78b
